Glimpse Grave.disable: @Check[type:religion|dc:45|name:Bless the tombstone] (legendary) to bless the tombstone or @Check[type:occultism|dc:50|name:Ward off the spirits] (trained) to ward off spirits
Glimpse Grave.hazarddescription: A tombstone bears the name of those who look upon it, causing their hearts to seize.
Glimpse Grave.stealthdetails: (expert) to notice the words on the tombstone waver

Stop Heart.name: Stop Heart
Stop Heart.description:
触发 A creature reads or touches the tombstone

效果 The haunt deals [[/r {8d10+44}[negative]]]{8d10+44负能量伤害} (@Check[type:will|dc:47|basic:true]) to all creatures within @Template[type:emanation|distance:60]{60尺} who can see the tombstone and can read any language. On a critical failure, a creature dies.

Grappling Spirit.name: Grappling Spirit
Grappling Spirit.publicNotes: When a great gladiator or wrestler meets their demise, their soul can sometimes linger out of a love for combat and sport. Every grappling spirit manifests a mask that represents the legacy of the warrior they were during their life.

Warrior's Mask.name: Warrior's Mask
Warrior's Mask.description: A grappling spirit wears a mask that allows them to abandon their original form and become a warrior focused solely on combat. This mask is quasi-corporeal, allowing it to be manipulated by both corporeal and incorporeal creatures. A creature who has the grappling spirit @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{擒抱 Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} can remove the mask as an Interact action by succeeding at an @Check[type:athletics|dc:29] check against the grappling spirit's Fortitude DC. Removing a grappling spirit's mask causes the spirit to fly into a frenzy. The grappling spirit becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened} and can use their extra action to Fly, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.PMbdMWc2QroouFGD]{Grapple}, or Strike. They also gain a +4 status bonus to damage rolls, and they take a -4 status penalty to AC and Reflex saving throws. If the mask is put back on, the grappling spirit ends their frenzy.

Ghostly Grasp.name: Ghostly Grasp
Ghostly Grasp.description: A grappling spirit can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.PMbdMWc2QroouFGD]{Grapple} corporeal creatures despite being incorporeal. The grappling spirit uses their Athletics check to Grapple as normal but can't use Athletics for other actions that require corporeal contact, like @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.SjmKHgI7a5Z9JzBx]{Force Open} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.ge56Lu1xXVFYUnLP]{Trip}.

Submission Lock.name: Submission Lock
Submission Lock.description:
需求 The grappling spirit has a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{擒抱 Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}

效果 The spirit saps their opponent's strength with a supernatural grip. The grappling spirit attempts an Athletics check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.PMbdMWc2QroouFGD]{Grapple} a creature they have grabbed or restrained, also adding [[/r {4d10+12}[negative]]]{4d10+12负能量伤害}, depending on the result.

Critical Success The creature takes double damage. If it's already enfeebled, it falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious}. If not, it is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} until the end of its next turn and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} for 1 minute.

Success The creature takes full damage and is enfeebled 1 until the end of its next turn.

Teleporting Clothesline.name: Teleporting Clothesline
Teleporting Clothesline.description:
需求 The grappling spirit has a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{擒抱 Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}

效果 The grappling spirit pushes the creature 15 feet in a straight line. The spirit immediately teleports 20 feet to intercept. They make a ghostly hand Strike against the creature. On a hit, the creature is knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{倒地 Prone}, and on a critical hit, it also takes an additional [[/r {2d6}[bludgeoning]]]{2d6 bludgeoning伤害} as it's driven to the ground.

Victory Celebration.name: Victory Celebration
Victory Celebration.description: If a spirit knocks a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious}, each creature within @Template[type:emanation|distance:60]{60尺} that witnesses the victory is targeted with a @Check[type:will|dc:26|traits:mental,emotion,occult] @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.czO0wbT1i320gcu9]{Roaring Applause} spell. The spirit must spend all their actions until the end of the turn celebrating, and a new medal or belt appears on the spirit.

Grasping Dead.name: Grasping Dead
Grasping Dead.disable: @Check[type:religion|dc:22] (trained) to ritually pray for the dead or @Check[type:occultism|dc:24] (trained) to exorcise the spirits' anger; two total successes are required to disable the haunt
Grasping Dead.hazarddescription: Hands of the buried dead rise from the ground, grabbing and tearing at creatures in the area to drag them underground.
Grasping Dead.reset: The haunt deactivates 1 minute after all living creatures leave the area. After 1 hour, the haunt reactivates.
Grasping Dead.routine: (1 action) The grasping hands batter all creatures in the area, dealing [[/r {2d6+7}[bludgeoning]]]{2d6+7 bludgeoning伤害} (@Check[type:reflex|dc:26|basic:true] save). On a critical failure, a creature is dragged partially into the earth, becoming @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} until it @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escapes} (DC 26). If already immobilized, it's fully submerged and must hold its breath to avoid suffocation.

Shifting Earth.name: Shifting Earth
Shifting Earth.description:
触发 At least two creatures enter the area

效果 The earth shifts wildly as the hands of the dead spring forth from the ground. The area becomes difficult terrain. Creatures within the area are knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{倒地 Prone} unless they succeed at a @Check[type:reflex|dc:26] save. The haunt then rolls initiative.

Hungry Armor.name: Hungry Armor
Hungry Armor.description: A creature that Strikes a graveknight warmaster with a melee weapon must succeed at a @Check[type:reflex|dc:31] save or be disarmed of that weapon. If the creature critically fails, the weapon ends up in the graveknight's space. A creature that hits a graveknight warmaster with an unarmed attack must succeed at a @Check[type:reflex|dc:31] or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{擒抱 Grabbed} by the graveknight until the end of its next turn, it Escapes, or the graveknight moves, whichever comes first.

Rejuvenation.name: Rejuvenation
Rejuvenation.description:
When a graveknight is destroyed, its armor rebuilds its body over the course of [[/br 1d10 #days]]{1d10 days}-or more quickly if the armor is worn by a living host. If the body is destroyed before then, the process restarts.

A graveknight can only be permanently destroyed by obliterating its armor (such as with @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.r7ihOgKv19eJQnik]{Disintegrate}), transporting it to the Positive Energy Plane, or throwing it into the heart of a volcano.

Sacrilegious Aura.name: Sacrilegious Aura
Sacrilegious Aura.description:
@Template[type:emanation|distance:30]{30尺} @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{灵光}

When a creature in the aura uses a positive spell or ability, the graveknight automatically attempts to counteract it, with a [[/r 1d20+23 #Counteract]]{+23 counteract modifier}.

Devastating Blast.name: Devastating Blast
Devastating Blast.description:
The graveknight unleashes a @Template[type:cone|distance:30] of energy. Creatures in the area take [[/r {8d12}[electricity]]]{8d12 electricity伤害} (@Check[type:reflex|dc:34|basic:true] save).

The graveknight can use this ability once every [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Devastating Blast]]{1d4轮}.

Exemplar of Violence.name: Exemplar of Violence
Exemplar of Violence.description:
频率 每轮一次

效果 The graveknight attempts a Strike as their armor flashes with sinister power that spurs allies to violence. After the Strike, allies who can see the graveknight can use a reaction to Step or Stride, but they must end this movement in a space adjacent to an enemy. One ally of the graveknight's choice can instead use a reaction to Strike.

Graveknight's Curse.name: Graveknight's Curse
Graveknight's Curse.description:
This curse affects anyone who wears a graveknight's armor for at least 1 hour.

豁免检定 @Check[type:will|dc:39] save

Onset 1 hour

阶段1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 1} and cannot remove the armor (1天)

阶段2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 2}, the creature's Speed is reduced by 10, and cannot remove the armor (1天)

阶段3 dies and transforms into the armor's graveknight.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.6rnB7nK6J6zF4vea]{Effect: Graveknight's Curse}

Phantom Mount.name: Phantom Mount
Phantom Mount.description:
HP 85; AC 34, Fort +23, Ref +20, Will +20

The graveknight summons a supernatural mount as per @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.WPKJOhEihhcIm2uQ]{Phantom Steed}, heightened to a level equal to half the graveknight's level.

Unlike phantom steed, the steed's AC and saving throw bonuses are all 4 lower than the graveknight's, and the steed has one-third the graveknight's Hit Points (rounded down).

If the steed is destroyed, the graveknight must wait 1 hour before using this ability again.

Ruinous Weapons.name: Ruinous Weapons
Ruinous Weapons.description: Any weapon or unarmed attack the graveknight uses gains the effects of the +1 greater striking and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.TEa1oKZbwsOvC6TZ]{Greater Shock} weapon runes.

Weapon Master.name: Weapon Master
Weapon Master.description: The graveknight has access to the critical specialization effects of any weapons it wields.

Command Zombie.name: Command Zombie
Command Zombie.description:
Krant intones blasphemous words to gain control over a zombie he can see within 100 feet. A zombie that is mindless and not under someone else's control falls under his control automatically; otherwise, the zombie or its controller can attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:22] save to avoid being controlled (whichever has the higher modifier). The target zombie is temporarily immune for 24 hours if successful. The attempt fails if the zombie is the same level as Krant or higher.

The zombie remains controlled by Krant until either is destroyed. Krant can control up to 8 zombies at a time. If Krant would control a number of zombies over this limit, he chooses which to release.

Create Zombies.name: Create Zombies
Create Zombies.description:
Krant can create lesser zombies with a 1-hour ritual. During this time, Krant chants and performs an unholy dance over the corpses he intends to animate. Unlike normal rituals, this doesn't require a skill check or Cost. At the end of this hour, Krant can create one 1st- or 2nd-level zombie, or two zombies of level 0 or lower. These are automatically under Krant's control and count toward the limit of Command Zombie. Any zombies created by Krant still count toward the XP budget of an encounter normally.

Krant has created enough individual zombies to form shambler troops, which are effectively 4th-level creatures. Rather than creating them directly, he needed to train weaker zombies to work as troops.

Level -1 Zombies

  • @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary.0plBflWwrCWQO2RO]{Zombie Shambler}

Level 0 Zombies

  • @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.book-of-the-dead-bestiary.ZqZlji7aCGCGATMP]{Zombie Snake}

Level 1 Zombies

  • @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.blog-bestiary.uPeDOylL6zsZKSIs]{Goblin Zombie}
  • @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary.KxN9aGFGPxl6oLGF]{Plague Zombie}

Level 2 Zombies

  • @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.book-of-the-dead-bestiary.qO20so7Mv2pmsLL1]{Husk Zombie}
  • @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary.Ix1PziAEk9IIMYBz]{Zombie Brute}

Shamble Forth.name: Shamble Forth
Shamble Forth.description:
频率 每轮一次

效果 Each zombie controlled by Krant Strides 5 feet (or Burrows, Climbs, Flies, or Swims 5 feet if it has the corresponding movement type).

Whispering Scythe.name: Whispering Scythe
Whispering Scythe.description:
触发 An undead controlled by Krant and within 20 feet of him is destroyed

需求 Krant is holding his scythe

效果 Krant draws the creature's soul into his scythe. The next time he makes a scythe Strike, the soul is released and the Strike deals an extra [[/r {1d6}[negative]]]{1d6负能量伤害}. The scythe can hold only one soul at a time.

Hollow Serpent.name: Hollow Serpent
Hollow Serpent.publicNotes:
A hollow serpent is the dried and shriveled husk of an enormous constrictor snake, animated by fell magic to serve its masters. According to the oldest holy books of serpentfolk, the first hollow serpents were raised by Ydersius. The god took the cast-off skins of great snakes and filled them with hunger and hatred, a bottomless yearning for mortal life that could never be filled. In due course, the priests of the serpentfolk learned to replicate their lord's trick, and in the millennia since the serpentfolk's fall, the knowledge has slithered into the libraries of other necromancers and sorcerers.

Despite their menacing reputation and great power, hollow serpents are a relatively uncomplicated creation. They were designed first and foremost as guardians, and serpentfolk liches of a suitable level of power are sometimes accompanied by hollow serpents. A few have struck out on their own over the years, usually due to outliving their original creators. Driven by their hunger and dim intellect, they take up residence in remote ruins or deep caverns. Those that study such things believe at least one serpent, perhaps one of the original creatures made by Ydersius, survives in the mountains west of Geb.

Desiccation Aura.name: Desiccation Aura
Desiccation Aura.description:
@Template[type:emanation|distance:30]{30-feet} @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{灵光}

A cloud of choking, acrid dust swirls about the hollow serpent, draining moisture from any enemy within. A creature entering the aura or starting its turn in the aura must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:34] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2}和@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{缓慢 Slowed 1} for [[/r 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4轮} ([[/r 2d4 #rounds]]{2d4轮} on a critical failure). A creature that succeeds is temporarily immune for 24 hours.

Divine Guardian.name: Divine Guardian
Divine Guardian.description:
触发 An ally within the hollow serpent's reach is attacked

效果 The hollow serpent interposes a coil of its body or tail between the ally and attacker. The triggering attack targets the hollow serpent instead of the original target.

Slithering Strike.name: Slithering Strike
Slithering Strike.description: The hollow serpent Strides or Climbs and makes a jaws Strike at the end of that movement. If the hollow serpent began this action @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{藏匿 Hidden}, it remains hidden until after this ability's Strike.

Horde Lich.name: Horde Lich
Horde Lich.publicNotes:
At first glance, a horde lich looks like a skeleton packed with too many bones. In combat, the true purpose of these extra parts becomes clear as limbs peel off, expanding and reassembling into another nimble skeletal form. Regardless of the number, the single lich mind controls them all, and if any of them survive an encounter, they can rebuild the whole given enough time and raw materials.

A desire to live eternally motivates a spellcaster to become a lich, and necromantic knowledge makes the desire real. The typical lich takes the most direct path, keeping their undead form fairly close to their appearance in life. But undeath can also bring greater freedom for those with a less conventional view of what they can become. The horde lich and runecarved lich reshape themselves entirely.

Rejuvenation.name: Rejuvenation
Rejuvenation.description: When a lich is destroyed, its soul immediately transfers to its @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.NEbr7nKuiluJgBHT]{Soul Cage}. A lich can be permanently destroyed only if its soul cage is found and destroyed.

Shatter Block.name: Shatter Block
Shatter Block.description:
触发 A creature scores a critical hit on the horde lich

需求 The horde lich has at least one servitor attached (see Servitor Assembly)

效果 The critical hit is a normal hit instead. One of the horde lich's servitors detaches from them and is placed in an open, adjacent space, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{倒地 Prone}. The servitor takes the damage from the triggering attack.

Servitor Assembly.name: Servitor Assembly
Servitor Assembly.description:
A horde lich has three servitor bodies folded up and attached to themself, usually in the ribcage, on the arms, and around the legs. The lich detaches one of these servitors and places it in any open, adjacent space. The lich can alternatively take this action to reattach an adjacent servitor.

The lich and their servitors share actions and Hit Points, and the servitors use the same statistics as the lich. Spells and effects that target the lich or their servitors affect all of them equally, but they're still treated as just one creature when targeted by spells and attacks. The horde lich attempts only one save against such effects, but they take a -2 circumstance penalty to defend against effects that target both the lich and one or more detached servitors. Whenever the horde lich Casts a Spell, they can choose to have the spell originate from themself or from any one of their detached servitors. If the horde lich is destroyed, all attached servitors are destroyed as well. If a servitor is dealt a critical hit, it's destroyed (and the horde lich takes the damage as normal).

Servitor Attack.name: Servitor Attack
Servitor Attack.description: Each of the horde lich's detached servitors Strike, with a -2 circumstance penalty on the attack roll. Each of these Strikes counts toward the lich's multiple attack penalty, but the penalty doesn't increase until after all the attacks.

Servitor Lunge.name: Servitor Lunge
Servitor Lunge.description:
需求 The horde lich's last action was a critical hit with a melee Strike, and the horde lich has at least one servitor attached

效果 One of the lich's attached servitors detaches adjacent to the target, and the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{擒抱 Grabbed} by that servitor.

Servitor Realignment.name: Servitor Realignment
Servitor Realignment.description: Each of the horde lich's detached servitors can either Interact or take a basic action with the move trait. The lich chooses which action each of them takes.

Steady Spellcasting.name: Steady Spellcasting
Steady Spellcasting.description: If a reaction would disrupt the horde lich's spellcasting action, the lich attempts a @Check[type:flat|dc:15]. On a success, the action isn't disrupted.

Hungry Ghost.name: Hungry Ghost
Hungry Ghost.publicNotes:
Hungry ghosts arise from those who didn't receive proper burials or whose graves were neglected. They are not bound to a site or item but are compelled to see opportunities to commit good deeds in hopes of gaining favors that can aid them in achieving a final rest. Their need to feed on living energy often conflicts with this goal, however.

Tethered to the world after death by powerful emotions that haven't been resolved, ghosts haunt the living as sad echoes of their former selves.

Living Visage.name: Living Visage
Living Visage.description: While they have more than 30 HP, the hungry ghost appears to be a living creature. They have an automatic result of 34 on Deception checks and DCs to conceal their undead status and can Feed on the Living covertly.

Feed on the Living.name: Feed on the Living
Feed on the Living.description:
The hungry ghost touches a creature in reach. If the target is a living creature, it takes damage from the ghost's ghostly touch with a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:24] save. If the ghost is in their living visage, they can disguise Feed on the Living as a benign touch and delay the effects for 1 minute while keeping the target unaware of the effect. A creature can be affected by only one delayed Feed on the Living at a time, and if the ghost loses their living visage during that minute, the Feed on the Living is lost.

Critical Success The target's life energy overpowers the ghost. The hungry ghost takes [[/r {5}[positive]]]{5 positive伤害}, and the target is unaffected.

Success The target takes half damage, and the hungry ghost regains HP equal to the damage dealt.

Failure The target takes full damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} for 1 minute, and the hungry ghost regains HP equal to the damage dealt.

Critical Failure The target takes double damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} for 1 minute, and the hungry ghost regains HP equal to the damage dealt.

Ravenous Undoing.name: Ravenous Undoing
Ravenous Undoing.description: In each 24-hour period, the hungry ghost must use Feed on the Living to consume 30 HP (any HP the ghost would gain count toward this total, even if the ghost has enough HP that they don't actually regain the full amount). If the ghost hasn't consumed enough HP, they mindlessly and recklessly feed on any living creature they come across until satiated.

Rejuvenation.name: Rejuvenation
Rejuvenation.description: When destroyed, hungry ghosts reform after [[/r 2d4 #Rejuvenation]]{2d4 days} fully healed at whatever location they were at when last destroyed. They're only permanently destroyed when they have been given a proper burial, have had their grave cleaned and maintained for at least a year, or have been judged to be redeemed by Pharasma.

Hunter Wight.name: Hunter Wight
Hunter Wight.publicNotes:
Dangers deep in the wilderness claim the life some lone scout or hunter. When they arise as wights, they renew their hunt with equal vigor, but all the living are now their prey. Hunter wights prefer to seek strategic ground, frequently taking residence atop hills or within abandoned watchtowers and keeps.

Wights are undead beings of spite who primarily stalk places related to death.

Final Snare.name: Final Snare
Final Snare.description:
触发 The hunter wight is reduced to 0 Hit Points

效果 The hunter wight has rigged their own body with a snare, which they trigger before being destroyed. Slivers of bone launch at an adjacent creature, dealing [[/r {4d8}[piercing]]]{4d8 piercing伤害} (@Check[type:reflex|dc:25|basic:true]).

Drain Life.name: Drain Life
Drain Life.description: When the hunter wight damages a living creature using an unarmed attack or their bound weapon, they gain 7 temporary Hit Points, and the creature must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:22] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1}. Further damage dealt by the hunter wight's unarmed and bound weapon attacks increases the value of the drained condition by 1 on a failed save, to a maximum of drained 4.

Spawn Hunter Wight.name: Spawn Hunter Wight
Spawn Hunter Wight.description: A living humanoid killed by a hunter wight's weapon or claw Strike rises as a hunter wight spawn after [[/r 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4轮}. This spawn is under the command of the hunter wight that killed them. They don't have drain life or spawn hunter wight and are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{笨拙 Clumsy 2} for as long as they're a hunter wight spawn. If the creator of the hunter wight spawn dies, the hunter wight spawn becomes a fully autonomous hunter wight; they regain their free will, gain drain life and spawn hunter wight, and are no longer clumsy

Husk Zombie.name: Husk Zombie
Husk Zombie.publicNotes:
Rather than allow a body to rot, some necromancers attempt to dry-cure the corpse to prevent further deterioration. Combined with special reagents, this process can preserve a rudimentary form of intelligence, allowing husk zombies to act more like predators than their mindless kin. Most husk zombies have no memories of their prior lives, though some keep trinkets from that time, oblivious as to why they value such items. A rare few husk zombies retain most of their former knowledge, though they tend to have gaps in their memory.

Simple to create and varied in purpose, these shambling undead are often used for their strength and endless stamina to conduct boring, repetitive tasks.

Slow.name: Slow
Slow.description: A husk zombie is permanently @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{缓慢 Slowed 1} and can't use reactions.

Sneak Attack.name: 偷袭 Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description:
The husk zombie deals an additional 1d6 precision damage to flat-footed creatures.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.SneakAttack]

Sudden Surge.name: Sudden Surge
Sudden Surge.description:
触发 The husk zombie's turn begins

效果 The husk zombie has a sudden burst of speed. They are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened} this turn and can use the extra action only to Stride or Strike. If the husk zombie's first action this turn is a melee Strike, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{措手不及 Flat-Footed} against the attack.

The husk zombie can't use Sudden Surge again until after they spend at least 10 minutes standing motionless.

Ice Mummy.name: 冰封木乃伊 Ice Mummy
Ice Mummy.publicNotes:
高处的寒冷加上强风和较少的氧气，形成了一种可以保存尸体的效应，通过自然过程将其木乃伊化。大多数冰封木乃伊是由邪教组织故意制造的，也有极少数是自愿转化的。

木乃伊化的通用性让木乃伊能通过各种各样的方法创造——自然、仪式、炼金术，以及所有这些的结合。

Great Despair.name: 高等绝望灵光 Great Despair
Great Despair.description:
@Template[type:emanation|distance:30]{30尺} @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{灵光}

在冰封木乃伊绝望灵光中的生物陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{惊惧 Frightened 1}状态。它们的惊惧状态在灵光范围内时无法自然恢复，但是在离开灵光范围后立即恢复。当一个生物第一次进入该灵光范围时，它必须通过@Check[type:will|dc:24]豁免（在受到惊惧状态带来的减值之后），否则@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{麻痹 Paralyzed}[[/r 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4轮}。该生物之后在24小时内临时免疫本能力。

Snow Vision.name: 降雪视觉 Snow Vision
Snow Vision.description: 雪不会阻碍冰封木乃伊的视觉；它会忽略降雪带来的@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{隐蔽 Concealed}状态。

Channel Rot.name: 引导寒腐症 Channel Rot
Channel Rot.description: 冰封木乃伊能通过它们持握的任何近战武器施加寒腐症。

Cold Rot.name: 寒腐症 Cold Rot
Cold Rot.description:
该苦难无法被降到阶段1以下，其造成的伤害也无法被治疗，直到成功地使用@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.OyFCwQuw8XRazsNr]{移除诅咒 Remove Curse}或类似效果；在这之后，这个苦难可以像普通疾病一样被移除。被寒腐症杀死的生物会变为冰晶，并且除了通过7环@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.kqhPt9344UkcGVYO]{起死回生 Resurrect}仪式或类似的魔法手段之外无法复活。

豁免检定 @Check[type:fortitude|dc:24]

阶段1 持续1轮的@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{缓慢 Slowed 1}，这之后携带但不发病 (1分钟)

阶段2 [[/r {5d6}[negative]+{2d6}[cold]]]{5d6负能量伤害和2d6寒冷伤害}和@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{呆滞 Stupefied 2} (1天)

Frozen Breath.name: 冰冻吐息 Frozen Breath
Frozen Breath.description:
冰封木乃伊呼出60锥形范围的锋利冰锥，造成[[/r {5d6}[cold]+{4d6}[slashing]]]{5d6寒冷和4d6挥砍伤害}（@Check[type:reflex|dc:26|basic:true]豁免）。

冰封木乃伊在[[/r 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4轮}内无法再次使用本能力。

Ichor Slinger.name: Ichor Slinger
Ichor Slinger.publicNotes: While the typical snake oil salesperson seeks riches, some medical fraudsters become so enamored with the swindler lifestyle they reanimate to keep living the lie. Known as ichor slingers, these cadaverous alchemists disguise themselves to walk among the living. There they gleefully concoct tonics and peddle cure-alls, charismatically convincing bystanders to overlook questionable ingredients and credentials. Ichor slingers feed on others' attention and trust, caring little for clients' health so long as buyers imbibe the offered medicines. Conversely, rejection infuriates ichor slingers. The undead often stalk, subdue, and administer unwanted medicines to those who snub them. When not selling "panaceas," ichor slingers harvest macabre ingredients to make dubious new medicines.

Mystery Ingredients.name: Mystery Ingredients
Mystery Ingredients.description:
@Template[type:emanation|distance:60] @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{灵光}

Creatures in the aura take a -2 status penalty to checks to Identify Alchemy, Recall Knowledge about alchemical subjects, or examine snake oil effects. When a creature first enters the area, if it hears the ichor slinger talking, it must attempt a secret @Check[type:will|dc:23|traits:secret] save against the slinger's Deception DC. On a failure, it treats its next failed check to Identify Alchemy or Recall Knowledge about alchemical subjects in the next 24 hours as though it were a critical failure instead. This is an auditory misfortune effect.

Brew Tomb Juice.name: Brew Tomb Juice
Brew Tomb Juice.description:
Cost 1 batch of infused reagents

效果 The ichor slinger creates a vial of tomb juice, an alchemical tonic that has the infused trait and becomes inert after 24 hours. Tomb juice has the effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.xBZCVHAa1SnR8Xul]{Snake Oil}, and maybe more depending on the results of the ichor slinger's @Check[type:crafting|dc:20] check.

Critical Success The slinger chooses one of the following items and adds its effects to the tomb juice: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.AJ1dC7EtTIfBey0M]{Antidote (Moderate)}，@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.biRbqKo2C97XLfQ0]{Antiplague (Moderate)}，@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.TZUskLT7yvP7N2co]{Elixir of Life (Lesser)}，@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.QGXNqpP5KvSldoZz]{Giant Scorpion Venom}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.mj9i9GeQTADByNPZ]{Juggernaut Mutagen (Moderate)}. Poisons created in this way gain an onset of 1 round, gain the ingested trait, and lose any contact, inhaled, or injury traits.

Success As critical success, but the slinger chooses from @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.ktjFOp3U0wQD9t0Z]{Antidote (Lesser)}，@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.UqinuuCWePTYGhVO]{Antiplague (Lesser)}，@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.hDLbR56Id2OtU318]{Elixir of Life (Minor)}，@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.qQqAY59NgGNoy2xr]{Graveroot}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.xE0EdDrf734l2fQH]{Juggernaut Mutagen (Lesser)}.

Exhume.name: Exhume
Exhume.description:
需求 The ichor slinger is adjacent to a dead creature that hasn't already been affected by Exhume

效果 The ichor slinger harvests portions of the corpse to gain 1 dose of infused reagents, or 2 infused reagents if the creature was undead.

Force Feed.name: Force Feed
Force Feed.description:
需求 The ichor slinger has a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{擒抱 Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} and is holding tomb juice, an alchemical elixir, or an alchemical poison

效果 The ichor slinger forces the target to consume the alchemical item.

Iroran Mummy.name: 义洛理门徒木乃伊 Iroran Mummy
Iroran Mummy.publicNotes:
一些开明的义洛理信徒，尤其是武僧，对自己的身体运转非常了解，他们能感觉到因年老而临近的死亡。将死亡的那一刻精确到小时，少数被选中的采用了一种自我木乃伊化的方法。这些生与死的大师们留下它们的身躯来看守义洛理的寺庙。

木乃伊化的通用性让木乃伊能通过各种各样的方法创造——自然、仪式、炼金术，以及所有这些的结合。

Aura of Peace.name: 平和灵光 Aura of Peace
Aura of Peace.description:
@Template[type:emanation|distance:30]{30尺} @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{灵光}

当一个生物进入灵光或在灵光内开始回合时，他受到法术@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.b515AZlB0sridKSq]{安定心神 Calm Emotions}的影响，持续1分钟，@Check[type:will|dc:27]豁免。豁免成功的生物临时免疫此能力1小时。如果义洛理门徒木乃伊采取了敌对行动，平和灵光就会被压制，已经受其影响的人也不再受影响。义洛理门徒木乃伊必须花10分钟的时间进行冥想才能恢复光环。

Robe Tangle.name: 长袍缠身 Robe Tangle
Robe Tangle.description:
触发 一个邻接木乃伊的生物对木乃伊的近战打击失手。

效果 木乃伊与攻击者互换位置，攻击者被木乃伊那条活化的衣带@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{擒抱 Grabbed}。逃脱DC为29，破拆DC为27，一个生物可以通过命中AC 27并造成至少20的挥砍伤害来斩断衣带。木乃伊不能再次使用这个反应动作，直到它们通过交互动作夺回衣带。

Stunning Flurry.name: 震慑连击 Stunning Flurry
Stunning Flurry.description:
频率 每轮一次

效果 义洛理门徒木乃伊进行两次打击，如果两次都命中同一个生物，将两次伤害叠加再计算抗性和弱点，且目标必须成功通过@Check[type:fortitude|dc:29|traits:incapacitation]豁免否则获得@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{震慑 Stunned 1}（大失败时震慑3）；此豁免具有失能特征。

Iruxi Ossature.name: Iruxi Ossature
Iruxi Ossature.publicNotes:
Iruxis, also known as lizardfolk, are surrounded by the spirits of their ancestors—literally, as they honor their dead by incorporating their bones into the architecture of iruxi settlements. Decades of veneration by their descendants have caused primal power to accumulate within these remains. In times of crisis, these earth-encrusted bones reanimate as guardians of last resort. Iruxis often refer to these undead—spirits bathed in starlight animating bone and rock, fueled by the beliefs of the living—as "the twilight guardians."

Iruxi ossatures usually reanimate spontaneously when a nesting chamber is violated or blood is spilled in an iruxi settlement's main hall. Truly ancient settlements might be blessed with a few ossatures' presence at all times: guarding nurseries, reliquaries, and the sacred observatories where their descendants study the heavens. These particularly hardy ossatures are composed of fossilized bone and possess dinosaur-like shield frills, horns, or spiked tails.

Twilight Spirit.name: Twilight Spirit
Twilight Spirit.description: The faith of its descendants protects the iruxi ossature. It takes no damage from positive or negative energy, and it can be healed by either positive or negative energy.

Fossil Fury.name: Fossil Fury
Fossil Fury.description:
频率 once per hour

效果 s The iruxi ossature beckons with glowing hands, commanding the earth to trip up opponents and marshaling the bone walls of its protectorate to lash out at intruders. The floor in a @Template[type:cone|distance:30] in front of the ossature becomes difficult terrain for 1 minute. Any square of a wall built by iruxis that's in the cone lashes out, with fossilized claws damaging any enemy within 5 feet of the wall. This deals [[/r {6d6}[piercing]]]{6d6 piercing伤害} with a @Check[type:reflex|dc:22|basic:true]. A creature attempts the save only once, even if adjacent to more than one affected square of the wall. Fossil Fury has no effect on the ossature's allies and never damages iruxi eggs.

Terrain Advantage.name: Terrain Advantage
Terrain Advantage.description: Non-lizardfolk creatures in difficult terrain and non-lizardfolk creatures that are in water and lack a swim Speed are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{措手不及 Flat-Footed} to the iruxi ossature.

Totems of the Past.name: Totems of the Past
Totems of the Past.description:
The iruxi ossature visits visions made of starlight, resembling totemic paintings or constellation diagrams, upon creatures in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:30]. Any lizardfolk allies in the area are inspired, gaining a +1 status bonus to attack rolls, and each enemy in the area must succeed at a @Check[type:will|dc:21] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled}. Both effects last for 1 minute or until the ossature is destroyed, whichever comes first.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.UuEUZU1fSUb23yOk]{Effect: Totems of the Past}

Jitterbone Contortionist.name: Jitterbone Contortionist
Jitterbone Contortionist.publicNotes:
Aptly named jitterbones, halfling mortics are capable of controlling the density and rigidity of their skeletal structure. When relaxed, they have elongated, rubbery limbs. When they harden their bones, they become difficult to harm and bony spikes jut from their flesh.

Mortics are humanoids overwhelmed by negative energy who tenaciously cling to life, straddling the line between living and dead.

Consecration Vulnerability.name: Consecration Vulnerability
Consecration Vulnerability.description: A jitterbone in a place of worship dedicated to a non-evil deity or on sacred ground, such as an area blessed by @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.y3jlOfgsQH1JjkJE]{Sanctified Ground}, is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{缓慢 Slowed 1}.

Compression.name: Compression
Compression.description: The jitterbone can move through a gap at least 6 inches wide without Squeezing and can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.kMcV8e5EZUxa6evt]{Squeeze} through a gap at least 2 inches wide.When the jitterbone successfully Squeezes, they move through the tight space at full Speed. Narrow confines aren't difficult terrain for a jitterbone.

Death Gasp.name: Death Gasp
Death Gasp.description:
The jitterbone draws in a deep breath and holds it, temporarily suspending their biological processes and becoming undead. The jitterbone gains the undead trait and becomes immune to bleed, death effects, disease, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{麻痹 Paralyzed}, poison, and sleep. Any such effects the jitterbone is currently inflicted with are suspended but take effect again once they take a breath.

Death Gasp lasts as long as the jitterbone holds their breath (up to 8 rounds).

Osseous Defense.name: Osseous Defense
Osseous Defense.description:
The jitterbone elongates their bones, causing jagged bone spikes to protrude from their skin. While Osseous Defense is active, the jitterbone can make bone spike and bone dart Strikes and gains resistance 5 to piercing damage and slashing damage. The jitterbone loses Compression while their Osseous Defense is active. The jitterbone can end Osseous Defense as a single action, retracting their bones back into their body.

Melee 1 bone spike [[/r 1d20+14 #Bone Spike Attack]]{+14}/[[/r 1d20+14 #Bone Spike Attack]]{+9}/[[/r 1d20+14 #Bone Spike Attack]]{+4} (finesse), Damage [[/r {2d8+2}[piercing]]]{2d8+2穿刺} plus @Localize[PF2E.PersistentDamage.Bleed1d6.success]

Ranged 1 bone dart [[/r 1d20+14 #Bone Dart Attack]]{+14}/[[/r 1d20+14 #Bone Dart Attack]]{+10}/[[/r 1d20+14 #Bone Dart Attack]]{+6} (agile, thrown 20 feet), Damage [[/r {2d6+2}[piercing]]]{2d6+2穿刺}

Lacedon.name: Lacedon
Lacedon.senses: corpse scent (模糊感官), 黑暗视觉
Lacedon.publicNotes:
Feared by mariners and coastal dwellers everywhere, the aquatic ghouls known as lacedons are said to be the spawn of an ancient crew of sailors who became lost at sea and were forced to resort to cannibalism to survive. Their appearance is the stuff of a diver's nightmare, supplementing the vicious traits of their land-bound kin with spines, fins, and wide mouths bristling with needle-sharp teeth like piscine predators of the nethermost ocean depths.

Devious and cunning, ghouls can be found anywhere corpses are laid to rest, forever seeking to satisfy their boundless craving for humanoid flesh.

vkuk04wj4sfihq3b.name: corpse scent (模糊感官) 1 英里
vkuk04wj4sfihq3b.description: The lacedon can smell humanoid corpses in the water from up to 1 mile away.

Consume Flesh.name: Consume Flesh
Consume Flesh.description:
需求 The lacedon is adjacent to the corpse of a creature that died within the last hour.

效果 The lacedon devours a chunk of the corpse and regains [[/r {2d6}[healing]]]{2d6 Hit Points}.

It can regain Hit Points from any given corpse only once.

Ghoul Fever.name: Ghoul Fever
Ghoul Fever.description:
豁免检定 @Check[type:fortitude|dc:16]

阶段1 携带但不发病(1天)

阶段2 [[/r {2d6}[negative]]]{2d6负能量伤害} and regains half as many Hit Points from all healing (1天)

阶段3 as stage 2 (1天)

阶段4 [[/r {2d6}[negative]]]{2d6负能量伤害} and gains no benefit from healing (1天)

阶段5 as stage 4 (1天)

阶段6 dead, and rises as a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary.LHHgGSs0ELCR4CYK]{Ghoul} the next midnight.

Paralyzing Spew.name: Paralyzing Spew
Paralyzing Spew.description:
The lacedon discharges a spray of carrion vomit at a creature within 20 feet, dealing [[/r {1d6}[poison]]]{1d6 poison伤害} with a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:17|basic:true]. A non-elf creature that fails its save is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{麻痹 Paralyzed}. It can attempt a new save to end the paralysis at the end of each of its turns, and the DC cumulatively decreases by 1 on each such save.

The lacedon can't use Paralyzing Spew again for [[/r 1d4 #Recharge]]{1d4轮}.

Battlefield Bound.name: Battlefield Bound
Battlefield Bound.description: Without a call to war, a last guard can stray only a short distance from the location they failed to defend, typically 120 feet. Some last guards are instead bound to a province, kingdom, or nation, rather than a specific location.

Rejuvenation.name: Rejuvenation
Rejuvenation.description: When a last guard is destroyed, they re-form after [[/r 2d4 #days]]{2d4 days} within the location they're bound to, fully healed. A last guard can be permanently destroyed and move on to the afterlife only if they successfully defend the location they're bound to from large-scale attack, or fulfill a call to war.

Frightful Battle Cry.name: Frightful Battle Cry
Frightful Battle Cry.description:
The last guards unleash a soul-shaking bellow in unison. All creatures in a @Template[type:cone|distance:60] take [[/r {7d6}[sonic]]]{7d6 sonic伤害} (@Check[type:will|dc:42|basic:true]). Any creature that fails its save is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{惊惧 Frightened 3} (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{惊惧 Frightened 4} on a critical failure).

If the troop occupies 8 or fewer squares, this area decreases to a @Template[type:cone|distance:30].

Ghostly Blades.name: Ghostly Blades
Ghostly Blades.description:
1 to 3

频率 每轮一次

效果 The last guards engage in a coordinated attack with their spectral curve blades against each enemy within 5 feet (@Check[type:reflex|dc:40|basic:true]). The damage depends on the number of actions.

1 [[/r {1d8+2}[slashing]+{1d8}[negative]]]{1d8+2 slashing and 1d8负能量伤害}

2 [[/r {2d8+14}[slashing]+{2d8}[negative]]]{2d8+14 slashing and 2d8负能量伤害}

3 [[/r {3d8+14}[slashing]+{3d8}[negative]]]{3d8+14 slashing and 3d8负能量伤害}

Spectral Charge.name: Spectral Charge
Spectral Charge.description: The last guards charge, swarming through their foes. The troop Flies up to double its Speed, dealing [[/r {4d8}[negative]]]{4d8负能量伤害} to each creature whose space it moves through (@Check[type:reflex|dc:40|basic:true]). Any creature that fails its save is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2} on a critical failure). The troop can affect each creature only once in a single use of Spectral Charge.

Troop Movement.name: Troop Movement
Troop Movement.description: Whenever the troop Strides, they first Form Up as a free action to condense into a 20-foot-by-20-foot area (minus any missing squares), then move up to their Speed. This works just like a Gargantuan creature moving.

Little Man In The Woods.name: Little Man In The Woods
Little Man In The Woods.publicNotes:
A murdered man left unburied in the wilds might return as a being called a "little man in the woods," his decayed corpse shriveling until it shrinks to the size of a child. Denied the respect of a burial that would smooth his spirit's transition to the afterlife, he is unable to leave the mortal plane and enter the realm of the spirits. Forgotten, lost, and miserable, suffering from unbearable hunger and cold, the little man in the woods is desperate to return to his mortal home and be laid to rest properly.

Despite his understandable motives, the little man in the woods has degenerated into a foul, twisted creature. He deceives travelers with plaintive cries then begs them to lead him to a home he barely recalls. He strangles all who can't or won't aid him, including those who lead him to the wrong home or otherwise delay his journey.

The little man in the woods lays his victims' bodies out in the wilds, leaving the corpse unburied and exposed. He guards these rotting corpses over years as they shrivel and decay, until each one rises as another little man in the woods. Like any of the actions he has been compelled to perform, creating more of his kind brings the little man in the woods no pleasure.

Voice Imitation.name: Voice Imitation
Voice Imitation.description: A little man in the woods can mimic the sounds of a person in distress by attempting a Deception check to Lie. The little man in the woods has a +4 circumstance bonus to this check.

Adopt Guise.name: Adopt Guise
Adopt Guise.description:
Playing on the expectations of surrounding creatures, the little man in the woods adopts the guise of a Small or Medium living person that matches the voice he imitates. This guise is subjective and entirely in the mind of each creature around him.

A creature that doesn't believe the little man in the woods' voice imitation sees the little man in the woods as he truly is and isn't fooled by Adopt Guise.

Strangle.name: Strangle
Strangle.description:
需求 The little man in the woods has a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{擒抱 Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}

效果 The little man in the woods tightens his grip around the creature's neck, extending the Grab, dealing [[/r {2d6+3}[bludgeoning]]]{2d6+3 bludgeoning伤害} with a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:24|basic:true], and strangling the creature for as long as it remains grabbed or restrained. A strangled creature can't speak, which prevents it from casting spells with a verbal component or activating items with a command component. The strangled creature must hold its breath or start suffocating.

Llorona.name: Llorona
Llorona.publicNotes:
Vengeful spirits called lloronas arise from people who died overcome with the grief and shame that comes with the tragic drowning of a child. In life, a llorona may have contributed to the child's death or simply lost the child to a horrible accident. In death, a llorona's pain manifests as a malevolent desire to drown others, imparting the same grief that they share with the person's loved ones. To this end, lloronas remain along riversides and other bodies of water in hopes of drawing their next victim and compelling them to drown themselves.

Lloronas look much like they did in life, except they wear elegant funeral attire in undeath. Though stories typically describe lloronas as women, reports from seasoned adventurers include accounts of lloronas appearing as different genders and with a variety of appearances.

Rejuvenation.name: Rejuvenation
Rejuvenation.description: When a llorona is destroyed, they re-form after [[/r 1d6 #days]]{1d6 days} at the site of their death. Resolving the injustice that led to a llorona's death puts them to rest permanently. Alternatively, successfully performing a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Dbd5W6G8U2vzWolN]{Consecrate} ritual at the site prevents them from re-forming.

Funereal Touch.name: Funereal Touch
Funereal Touch.description: A creature touched by a llorona must attempt a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:29] save. On a failure, the creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} (drained 2 on a critical failure) or increases their drained value by 1 (2 on a critical failure), up to a maximum of drained 4. Every time a creature becomes drained in this way, the llorona gains 10 temporary Hit Points for 1 hour.

Ghostly Grasp.name: Ghostly Grasp
Ghostly Grasp.description: A llorona can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.PMbdMWc2QroouFGD]{Grapple} corporeal creatures despite being incorporeal. The llorona uses their Athletics check to Grapple as normal but can't use Athletics for other actions that require corporeal contact, like Force Open or Trip.

Wail.name: Wail
Wail.description:
The llorona unleashes a somber wail. Each living creature within @Check[type:emanation|distance:120]{120尺} must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:31] save. Regardless of its result, the creature is then temporarily immune for 24 hours.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{震慑 Stunned 1}.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg]{Fascinated} with the nearest body of water and compelled to move toward the water and drown itself. If there's no nearby body of water, the creature instead remains still. The creature can attempt another @Check[type:will|dc:31] save at the end of each of its turns. On a success, the creature is no longer fascinated. Once the fascinated condition ends, the creature becomes stunned 1.

Critical Failure As failure, except the creature receives another Will save only at the end of a round in which it's submerged in water.

Locking Door.name: Locking Door
Locking Door.disable: @Check[type:athletics|dc:14|name:Push Back Against the Door] to push back against the door, @Check[type:crafting|dc:14|name:Wedge the Door Open] to wedge the door open, or @Check[type:thievery|dc:20|name:Jam the Lock] (trained) to jam the lock or open the lock afterward
Locking Door.hazarddescription: A door (or other portal) slams shut and locks.
Locking Door.stealthdetails: to notice the door sway slightly, even though there's no breeze

Shut In.name: Shut In
Shut In.description:
触发 A creature ends their move after passing through the doorway

效果 With an ethereal gust shimmering in the air, the door creaks as it swings shut and locks. The haunted door pushes anyone in its space into an adjacent space in the connecting chamber. A creature that would be pushed and succeeds at a @Check[type:reflex|dc:16] save selects which side of the door they end up on.

Mummified Cat.name: 木乃伊猫 Mummified Cat
Mummified Cat.publicNotes:
一些富人将他们喜爱的宠物制成木乃伊，或者希望利用动物的记忆残缺但本能强大的特性和天生武器将它们变成可怕的墓穴守护者。没有别的动物像猫科一样在来世中如此受信任，它们几乎无一例外地与已故法老葬在一起。

木乃伊化的通用性让木乃伊能通过各种各样的方法创造——自然、仪式、炼金术，以及所有这些的结合。

Aura of Repose.name: 安息灵光 Aura of Repose
Aura of Repose.description:
@Template[type:emanation|distance:60]{60尺} @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{灵光}

灵光范围内的尸体不会腐烂。这个灵光还会尝试反制任何会将灵光中的生物转化为不死生物的效果（反制等级为2，反制调整值[[/r 1d20+5 #Counteract]]{+5}）。

Pounce.name: 猛扑 Pounce
Pounce.description: 木乃伊猫行走并在这次移动结束后进行1次打击。如果木乃伊猫开始此动作时处于@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{藏匿 Hidden}状态，则它保持藏匿直到本能力的打击结束。

Sneak Attack.name: 偷袭 Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description:
木乃伊猫对措手不及的生物额外造成[[/r {1d4}[precision]]]{1d4精准伤害}。

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.SneakAttack]

Mummy Prophet Of Set.name: 赛特的木乃伊先知 Mummy Prophet Of Set
Mummy Prophet Of Set.senses: 沙尘视觉, 黑暗视觉
Mummy Prophet Of Set.publicNotes:
在古奥斯里昂。完全献身于邪神塞特的崇拜者大都要经历木乃伊化过程，以便在死后充当他的先知。

木乃伊化的通用性让木乃伊能通过各种各样的方法创造——自然、仪式、炼金术，以及所有这些的结合。

Great Despair.name: 高等绝望灵光 Great Despair
Great Despair.description:
@Template[type:emanation|distance:30]{30尺} @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{灵光}

在木乃伊先知的绝望灵光中的生物陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{惊惧 Frightened 1}状态。它们的惊惧状态在灵光范围内时无法自然恢复，但是在离开灵光范围后立即恢复。当一个生物第一次进入该灵光范围时，它必须通过@Check[type:will|dc:31]豁免（在受到惊惧状态带来的减值之后），否则@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{麻痹 Paralyzed}[[/r 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4轮}。该生物之后在24小时内临时免疫本能力。

Sand Vision.name: 沙尘视觉 Sand Vision
Sand Vision.description: 先知无视空气中的沙粒和尘埃所带来的@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{隐蔽 Concealed}状态。

Breath of Sand.name: 沙尘吐息 Breath of Sand
Breath of Sand.description:
需求 先知的沙尘暴能力正在生效；

效果 先知吸入它的沙尘暴，压制此效果直至先知的下一回合结束。它随即呼出充满负能量的沙子，范围@Template[type:cone|distance:120]，造成[[/r {7d6}[negative]+{7d6}[slashing]]]{7d6负能量和7d6挥砍伤害}（@Check[type:reflex|dc:33|basic:true]豁免）。

Channel Rot.name: 引导沙腐症 Channel Rot
Channel Rot.description: 赛特的木乃伊先知能通过它们持握的任何近战武器施加沙腐症。

Sand Form.name: 沙尘形态 Sand Form
Sand Form.description:
频率 每天一次

效果 先知失去了固体形态，化作一堆活化的沙子。在这种形态下，先知获得对物理伤害的抗力10，并免疫精准伤害。它们不能施展法术，启动物品，或使用具有攻击或操作特征的行动。它们获得40尺的飞行速度，并能从小型的缝隙中溜走。该效果持续5分钟，先知可以解消该效果。

Sand Rot.name: 沙腐症 Sand Rot
Sand Rot.description:
该苦难无法被降到阶段1以下，其造成的伤害也无法被治疗，直到成功地使用@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.OyFCwQuw8XRazsNr]{移除诅咒 Remove Curse}或类似效果；在这之后，这个苦难可以像普通疾病一样被移除。被寒腐症杀死的生物会变一堆沙子，并且除了通过7环@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.kqhPt9344UkcGVYO]{起死回生 Resurrect}仪式或类似的魔法手段之外无法复活。

豁免检定@Check[type:fortitude|dc:31]

阶段1 携带但不发病(1分钟)

阶段2 [[/r {12d6}[negative]]]{12d6负能量伤害}，@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{笨拙 Clumsy 1}，和@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{呆滞 Stupefied 2} (1天)

Sandstorm.name: 沙尘暴 Sandstorm
Sandstorm.description:
频率 每天一次

效果 先知创造出一团临时的沙尘暴，范围@Template[type:emanation|distance:30]，持续1分钟。此弥漫范围内的生物察觉检定受到-4环境减值，且必须成功通过@Check[type:fortitude|dc:33]豁免，或者屏住呼吸，否则会开始窒息。在回合结束时身处沙尘暴内的生物受到[[/r {2d6}[negative]+{1d6}[slashing]]]{2d6负能量和1d6挥砍伤害}。

Nasurgeth.name: Nasurgeth
Nasurgeth.publicNotes:
Nasurgeths are hungry voids with glowing eyestalks and thousands of teeth. They lurk deep beneath the waves where the sunlight doesn't reach. At night, they ascend to the skies and rain destruction and ruin down on all the living.

Darvakkas, also called nightshades, are a ravenous evil made up of equal parts darkness and malice. Originally creatures of the Outer Planes who travel to the convergence of the Shadow Plane and the Negative Energy Plane—where the power of nothingness obliterates them—these undead abominations are the physical embodiment of entropy. They burn with an intense hatred for all life, working to bring a final, dark night to the Material Plane where nothing but ash and ice remain.

As creatures twisted by darkness and shadow, darvakkas have a great aversion to sunlight and all sources of positive energy. On the Material Plane, they spend the hours of daylight hidden below ground, amid ruins, or submerged deep in the ocean's darkest chasms beyond the reach of the sun's rays, emerging when darkness shelters them overhead.

Darvakkas have an aura of entropy that attracts undead thralls to serve as warriors and heralds. They rarely seek alliances with each other or other creatures, existing in solitude as the heads of individual armies of the dead.

Midnight Depths.name: Midnight Depths
Midnight Depths.description:
@Template[type:emanation|distance:60]{60尺} @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{灵光}

A nasurgeth's entropy grows even stronger underwater. All water within the aura is completely dark (as 4th-level @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.4GE2ZdODgIQtg51c]{Darkness}). Magical light with a counteract level of 4th level or lower, along with magical light cantrips, are suppressed. A living creature entering or starting its turn in the aura takes [[/r {4d6}[negative]]]{4d6负能量伤害}, and the creature also takes an additional [[/r {2d10}[cold]]]{2d10寒冷伤害} if it's in water (@Check[type:fortitude|dc:39|basic:true]). If it fails, it's also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} for 1 minute and pulled 10 feet toward the nasurgeth.

Spray Black Bile.name: Spray Black Bile
Spray Black Bile.description:
触发 The nasurgeth takes slashing or piercing damage from a critical hit, or a swallowed creature cuts itself free

效果 Darkness and negative energy spill out from the nasurgeth's wound, dealing [[/r {8d8}[negative]]]{8d8负能量伤害} to creatures within 20 feet (@Check[type:fortitude|dc:40|basic:true]).

Sunlight Powerlessness.name: Sunlight Powerlessness
Sunlight Powerlessness.description: A nasurgeth caught in sunlight is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{震慑 Stunned 2}和@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{笨拙 Clumsy 2}.

Broken Barb.name: Broken Barb
Broken Barb.description:
需求 A creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{擒抱 Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} in the nasurgeth's jaws

效果 The nasurgeth breaks a tooth off in the target, who takes @Localize[PF2E.PersistentDamage.Bleed3d10.success] and is no longer grabbed or restrained. If the target is adjacent to a surface, the tooth also pins it in place, making it @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape} DC 45).

Ravenous Void.name: Ravenous Void
Ravenous Void.description: The nasurgeth barrels forward with their mouth open, Swimming twice in a straight line and moving through the spaces of Huge or smaller creatures. The nasurgeth deals the damage of their jaws Strike to each creature whose space they enter (@Check[type:reflex|dc:45|basic:true]). Any creature that critically fails is automatically Swallowed Whole.

Swallow Whole.name: 活吞 Swallow Whole
Swallow Whole.description:
Huge, [[/r {2d10+9}[bludgeoning]]]{2d10+9 bludgeoning}, Rupture 40

A living creature that ends its turn swallowed whole by a nasurgeth becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} or increases its drained condition by 1, and the nasurgeth gains 20 temporary Hit Points. A creature whose drained condition increases to 5 in this way dies.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.SwallowWhole]

Obrousian.name: Obrousian
Obrousian.publicNotes:
Spawned from sorrow and hatred, obrousians are undead merfolk who lurk in shallow places to prey upon hated land dwellers. The genesis of an obrousian is a tragic one: some merfolk forsake their aquatic homes when they fall in love with a land dweller, only to be spurned or rejected. Having given up their entire world for another and then feeling that new world closed off to them as well, merfolk can become emotionally overwhelmed. When such merfolk die, often overcome with sorrow and regret, they rise as obrousians.

Obrousians think of little other than taking revenge upon the land dwellers who specifically wronged them, and then upon anyone else with the misfortune to cross their paths. They can contort their bodies to take the guise of other humanoids, but doing so is painful, so obrousians use this ability only when absolutely necessary to enact their schemes. While they are capable of long-term planning, their underlying mental turmoil simmers beneath any careful preparation, and many obrousians foil their own plans with unexpected outbursts of emotion.

Obrousians are recognizable as the merfolk they once were before they died, though their bodies show obvious decay and their hands have elongated into sharp claws. Their voices are melodic and entrancing, belying their rotting bodies and turbulent minds, so some obrousians hide in tall reeds or under docks before speaking to their victims, lulling them into false comfort with a pleasant voice.

Waves of Sorrow.name: Waves of Sorrow
Waves of Sorrow.description:
@Template[type:emanation|distance:30]{30尺} @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{灵光}

When a creature ends its turn in the obrousian's waves of sorrow aura, the creature is overwhelmed by the sorrow that suffuses the obrousian's being. The creature must succeed at a @Check[type:will|dc:33] saving throw or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{麻痹 Paralyzed} for 1 round.

Change Shape.name: 变身 Change Shape
Change Shape.description:
The obrousian can take on the appearance of any kind of Small or Medium humanoid creature. This transformation increases their Speed to 25 feet and might remove their swim Speed depending on the form. It doesn't change their attack and damage modifiers with their Strikes, but it might change the damage type their Strikes deal (typically to bludgeoning damage).

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

Drowning Grasp.name: Drowning Grasp
Drowning Grasp.description: When a creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{擒抱 Grabbed} by the obrousian, the creature's lungs magically fill with water. A creature that can't breathe water is suffocating while it is grabbed.

Onryo.name: Onryo
Onryo.speed: flicker, 蛛行术, 水面行走
Onryo.publicNotes: Onryos are created when a person dies violently in the grip of extreme emotion, such as unbridled rage or overwhelming sorrow. These twisted undead return as beings of pure vengeance, seeking to endlessly spread suffering. Onryos torment those who killed them, but not by directly attacking their murderer. Instead, an onryo hunts down the friends, family members, and anyone connected to their foe. In doing so, the onryo inflicts as much torment as possible on the person responsible for their demise. An onryo's vengeful nature persists indefinitely; not even the death of their killer sates their lust for destruction. Vengeance is just a way for them to spread their pain to others, and they quickly find new targets for their ire. Onryos always wear funeral clothing, often dripping wet or covered in filth. Most of them also display wounds or signs indicating how they died. As they move, onryos seem to pop in and out of existence, making them difficult to track in combat.

Flicker.name: Flicker
Flicker.description: An onryo's erratic movement makes them difficult to target. If an onryo moves at least 10 feet during a move action, they gain @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealment} until the start of their next turn.

Onryo's Rancor.name: Onryo's Rancor
Onryo's Rancor.description:
需求 The onryo's last action was a successful claw Strike

效果 The onryo attempts to instill its need for vengeance into the creature. The onryo, with their touch, casts a 5th-level @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Q690d3mw3TUrKX7E]{Geas} on the creature they hit (@Check[type:will|dc:30]). On a failure, it's forced to seek and slay loved ones of the onryo's wrongdoer and anyone who attempts to defend them for up to one week. On a critical failure, the duration is 1 month and the creature gains Onryo's Rancor, which it's also compelled to use by the geas. Regardless of the outcome, the creature is temporarily immune to Onryo's Rancor from this individual for 1 year.

Vengeful Suffocation.name: Vengeful Suffocation
Vengeful Suffocation.description:
频率 once per hour

效果 The onryo channels their boundless resentment, manifesting it as a tangled clump of wet hair, a clot of rancid swamp mud, or other disgusting mass of matter in the throat of a creature within 30 feet. The creature must attempt a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:32] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 1}.

Failure The creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 2}.

Critical Failure The creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 3} and the mass fully blocks the creature's airway. The creature begins suffocating.

Pale Sovereign.name: Pale Sovereign
Pale Sovereign.publicNotes:
A pale sovereign is a rare form of undead arising from a terrible curse that afflicts only those of royal blood. This curse drains its victim's vitality slowly over time, almost appearing to be a form of long-term wasting disease that no medicine can ever cure. The royal stricken by the curse sickens and wastes away until they finally perish, rising as a pale sovereign after death. The appearance of a pale sovereign is similar to their form in life, but so deathly pale and gaunt that no one who resists the mind-clouding effects of their aura would mistake them as living.

The curse is known by many names across various worlds—the Wasting, Blighted Legacy, Unraveled Heraldry—but its effects are the same. After suffering the curse, members of a royal bloodline begin to die out, their descendants dwindling, until only one is left. Upon becoming the last remaining member of their line, the unfortunate royal undergoes the transformation into a pale sovereign, the power and potential of the entire line channeled into one extremely dangerous undead creature, even if the royal was relatively inconsequential and unskilled in life.

The methods of inflicting the curse vary. Generally it's the result of rare occult rituals requiring a spellcaster of great power. Sometimes the curse is used to target a royal line abusing its authority, but just as often it's used by malicious forces against benevolent rulers or simply out of spite by the instigating caster. Mentioned only in whispers and veiled allusions, the curse is greatly feared by royal families who know of it. Be cautious in your dealings, the rumors say, and be careful who you spurn, for you never know what power they may wield.

More rarely, a pale sovereign can arise spontaneously if the last of a royal line dies while under a curse or due to a curse, particularly if they died with tasks left unfinished or as the result of a betrayal. Any curse will do in these rare instances, and it's possible that the first pale sovereign formed in this way.

Though morose and brooding, pale sovereigns are usually neutral rather than evil. They're very protective of their demesnes and whatever subjects remain to them, however, and attacking a pale sovereign's territory is the swiftest way to draw their ire. If a pale sovereign is ousted from their country's central throne, they retreat to any other holdings they might still possess and rule those.

The attitudes of a pale sovereign's subjects vary. Many aren't even aware of their ruler's true nature. Among those who know the secret, some value their sovereign's protection and view them fondly. Others are uncomfortable with an undead eternal monarch, especially if the sovereign has become corrupt or bitter.

A pale sovereign's territory is indelibly marked by their presence. Plants wither and blacken, struggling to grow in dry and lifeless soil. Wild animals often rise as undead unless they receive special ritual burials, leading to packs of skeletal and zombified beasts roaming the territory. Such monsters don't harm the demesne's residents but are quick to attack any intruders not bearing the sovereign's sigil. Even the living sapient inhabitants of a pale sovereign's demesne tend to have a drained, washed-out appearance, as if one step away from the grave themselves.

Demesne Confinement.name: Demesne Confinement
Demesne Confinement.description: A pale sovereign is tied to their demesne, a territory of a 5-mile radius surrounding their home estate. They can't leave their demesne of their own accord. A pale sovereign taken from their demesne can't use any of their innate spells or rituals and gradually withers over the course of a week, turning to dust if they don't return before 7 days have passed.

Sense Visitors.name: Sense Visitors
Sense Visitors.description: A pale sovereign automatically knows when a creature enters or leaves their demesne, though this doesn't give them precise knowledge of the creature's location.

Aura of Charm.name: Aura of Charm
Aura of Charm.description:
@Template[type:emanation|distance:80]{80尺} @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{灵光}

The aura of a pale sovereign is beguiling and inviting, affecting creatures beginning their turns within it with an 8th-level @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.vLA0q0WOK2YPuJs6]{Charm} (@Check[type:will|dc:39] save). A creature that fails its Will save perceives the pale sovereign as they were in life, not their current undead form. A creature that succeeds at its save is then temporarily immune to that pale sovereign's aura for 24 hours.

Curse of Eternal Sleep.name: Curse of Eternal Sleep
Curse of Eternal Sleep.description:
The pale sovereign touches an adjacent living creature to send it into an endless slumber. The target must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:39] save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected and is temporarily immune for 24 hours.

Success The target becomes drowsy and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{缓慢 Slowed 1} for 1 minute.

Failure The target falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious}, though it doesn't fall @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{倒地 Prone} or release what it's holding. It can't awaken with a successful Perception check, though dealing any amount of damage to the creature breaks the slumber. If it's still unconscious after 1 hour, it awakens.

Critical Failure The target falls unconscious permanently, falling prone, and can't be awoken as long as the curse remains.

Siphon Vitality.name: Siphon Vitality
Siphon Vitality.description: The pale sovereign siphons the life force from creatures around them. All living creatures in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:30] take [[/r {6d8}[negative]]]{6d8负能量伤害} (@Check[type:fortitude|dc:39|basic:true]). The pale sovereign regains HP equal to the highest damage a single creature took from this effect.

Pale Stranger.name: Pale Stranger
Pale Stranger.publicNotes:
A pale stranger arises when a gunslinger is slain in a duel by an underhanded foe. Buried with their pistols, the corpse claws out of the grave to wreak vengeance upon their killer for cheating. Sometimes a pale stranger is created when a particularly petty gunslinger is beaten fairly and refuses to accept defeat, though such an individual must be especially self-delusional to retain the hatred necessary to spur the transformation. Whatever the circumstance, a pale stranger can wield their firearms with deadly grace and efficacy.

A revenant is a vengeful undead who stalks the one who killed them in life. They're relentless in the pursuit of their murderer, seeking a final justice.

Self-Loathing.name: Self-Loathing
Self-Loathing.description:
If a pale stranger sees their own reflection or any object important to them in life, they must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:30] save.

Critical Success The pale stranger is unaffected and can no longer be affected by that reflection or object in this way.

Success The pale stranger is distracted by self-loathing and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{缓慢 Slowed 1} for 1 round.

Failure The pale stranger becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg]{Fascinated} by the source of their self-loathing and does everything they can to destroy it until the end of their next turn.

Critical Failure The pale stranger becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} as long as the source of their self-loathing is apparent, until they're attacked, or until they see their murderer.

Sense Murderer.name: Sense Murderer
Sense Murderer.description: A pale stranger knows the direction of their murderer (as long as both are on the same plane), but not the distance.

Undying Vendetta.name: Undying Vendetta
Undying Vendetta.description: If the pale stranger's murderer dies, the pale stranger is immediately destroyed. A pale stranger that can't sense their murderer must attempt a @Check[type:flat|dc:11] once every 24 hours to avoid becoming @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized}和@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{倒地 Prone}; they immediately rise again once they can sense their murderer. A murderer who becomes undead does not trigger the pale stranger's destruction until the murderer is finally destroyed. The pale stranger gains a +2 status bonus to checks and DCs against their murderer.

Bullets of Vengeance.name: Bullets of Vengeance
Bullets of Vengeance.description: Shots from a pale stranger's firearms deal an additional [[/r {1d6}[precision]]]{1d6精准伤害}, or [[/r {2d6}[precision]]]{2d6精准伤害} against the one who murdered them. A creature who has never killed a living being doesn't take this precision damage. When a pale stranger critically succeeds at a ranged Strike with a pistol, the target must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:29] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{震慑 Stunned 1}.

Dead Shot.name: Dead Shot
Dead Shot.description:
频率 once per turn

需求 The pale stranger is wielding two loaded firearms

效果 The pale stranger takes aim at a target and shoots both of their firearms simultaneously. The pale stranger makes two ranged Strikes, one with each of the firearms, each using the pale stranger's current multiple attack penalty. Both Strikes must have the same target, who must be within the first range increment of both weapons.

If both attacks hit, combine their damage, and then add any other applicable effects from both weapons. The pale stranger adds any precision damage only once, to the attack of their choice. Combine the damage from both Strikes and apply resistances and weaknesses only once. This counts as two attacks when calculating the pale stranger's multiple attack penalty

Revenant Reload.name: Revenant Reload
Revenant Reload.description: The pale stranger reloads each firearm they're wielding, supernaturally generating new black powder and bullets. When firing these magical bullets, the firearm can't misfire, and the attack doesn't trigger reactions triggered by ranged attacks.

Phantom Footsteps.name: Phantom Footsteps
Phantom Footsteps.disable: @Check[type:religion|dc:17|name:Ward Off Lesser Spirits] (trained) to ritually ward off lesser spirits or @Check[type:occultism|dc:18|name:Excorcise the Spirit] to exorcise the spirit
Phantom Footsteps.hazarddescription: Audible footsteps approach from behind, but their source is not apparent.

Stalk.name: Stalk
Stalk.description:
触发 A creature passes by the footsteps' path

效果 Footsteps with no visible source closely shadow the triggering creature, then stop. The triggering creature must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:16] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{惊惧 Frightened 1}.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{惊惧 Frightened 2}.

Critical Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{惊惧 Frightened 3}.

Phantom Jailer.name: Phantom Jailer
Phantom Jailer.disable: @Check[type:athletics|dc:18|name:Seize the manacles] to seize the manacles from the spirit, @Check[type:intimidation|dc:19|name:Order the spirit to stand down] (trained) to order the spirit to stand down, or @Check[type:occultism|dc:20|name:Exorcise the spirit] to exorcise the spirit
Phantom Jailer.hazarddescription: A spirit appears and arrests the creature by clamping manacles around their wrists.

Capture.name: Capture
Capture.description:
触发 A creature touches the manacles

效果 The spirit attempts to lock the manacles around the triggering creature's wrists. The triggering creature must attempt a @Check[type:reflex|dc:23] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The spirit loosely places manacles around the creature's wrists. Removing the manacles requires a single action.

Failure The spirit clamps the manacles around the creature's wrists but fails to lock them. The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{措手不及 Flat-Footed}和@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{笨拙 Clumsy 1} until the manacles are removed as a 3-action activity.

Critical Failure The spirit clamps the manacles around the creature's wrists and locks them. The creature is flat-footed and clumsy 1 until the manacles are removed (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape} DC 23, simple lock).

Polong.name: Polong
Polong.publicNotes:
Polongs exist to serve their creators as loyal familiars, spies, and assassins. Their convenience makes them popular among the wicked, as each resides within a glass bottle which normally seems to contain only a small amount of red liquid. When addressed by their owner, a polong appears within their bottle as a tiny, beautiful humanoid drenched in blood. Forcing one to manifest outside the bottle reveals their true shape: a blood-soaked spirit with a hateful visage and sickle-shaped claws.

The ritual to create a polong originated in Minata and is known primarily by Tian-Sing spellcasters, but only those willing to practice such evil. The ritualist must collect the blood of a murdered humanoid in a small bottle and perform daily incantations, which can take up to 14 days. Once the polong forms, they drink the blood of their creator every day, most often taken from a finger inserted into their bottle. At the master's order, a polong will travel up to 10 miles away to locate a particular person, possess them, and either slowly whittle them down via possession until they die, or force them to attack anyone nearby until someone slays the victim in self-defense.

Bottle Bound.name: Bottle Bound
Bottle Bound.description: A polong is bound to the bottle from which they spawned. They can leave the bottle only at the will of their master and must return to it once every 24 hours to feed on their creator's blood. Otherwise, the polong withers and dies.

Natural Invisibility.name: Natural Invisibility
Natural Invisibility.description: A polong is naturally @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{Invisible} outside of their bottle. They become visible only when forced out of a possessed creature against their will. Shattering the polong's bottle also forces them to assume a visible form.

Regenerating Bond.name: Regenerating Bond
Regenerating Bond.description: When a polong possesses a creature, the polong's master gains temporary Hit Points equal to the victim's level × the victim's drained value caused by the possession. These temporary Hit Points last as long as the possession lasts.

Polong Possession.name: Polong Possession
Polong Possession.description:
The polong attempts to possess an adjacent corporeal creature. This has the same effect as the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.wU6hNzK8Yfqdmc8m]{Possession} spell (@Check[type:will|dc:26]), except the duration is 24 hours and, since the polong doesn't have a physical body, they're unaffected by that restriction of the spell. If the target has critically failed its save and become fully possessed by this polong before, it gets a save result one degree of success worse than it rolled.

A creature possessed by a polong becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1}和@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 1}. These conditions don't reduce naturally unless the polong spends an entire day without possessing the creature. For each consecutive day the polong is able to return and possess the creature, the drained and doomed values each increase by 1, to a maximum of 4. If the polong possesses a different creature, the conditions end for any creature it previously possessed.

Predatory Rabbit.name: 掠食兔 Predatory Rabbit
Predatory Rabbit.senses: 感知伙伴, 黑暗视觉
Predatory Rabbit.publicNotes:
生前胆小如鼠，掠食兔有着一副不起眼的外形，却是个快速且灵活的捕食者。它们最喜欢猎杀鸟类、松鼠、猫以及其他兔子。

超越死亡继续延续的忠诚纽带唤起宠物，它们在死后几天内从坟墓里爬出，回到过去的主人、家庭或族群身边。不幸的是，死亡不可逆转地改变了复生宠物。他们返回时成为具有攻击性的掠食性野兽，难以控制，容易发怒。即使是最友好的动物，在死后也会变得嗜虐且暴力——它们会首先将这可怕的性子用在它们眼中争夺主人注意力的生物上。而当复生宠物被主人抛弃、拒绝或冒犯时，它们的怒火就会转向主人。

Sense Companion.name: 感知伙伴 Sense Companion
Sense Companion.description: 一只掠食兔永远知道它生前所属主人或家庭的方向（只要他俩处于同一位面），但不知道距离。

Stench.name: 恶臭 Stench
Stench.description:
@Template[type:emanation|distance:10]{10尺} @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{灵光}

进入灵光或在灵光中开始回合的生物必须成功通过@Check[type:fortitude|dc:13]豁免，否则获得@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 1}（若大失败，则只要该生物还恶心，就会额外获得@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{缓慢 Slowed 1}）。身处灵光范围内时，受影响的生物在对抗疾病的豁免和从恶心中恢复的检定上受到-2环境减值。豁免成功的生物临时免疫本能力1分钟。

Feral Leap.name: 凶猛扑咬 Feral Leap
Feral Leap.description: 掠食兔跳跃至多陆地速度一半的高度和水平距离。这个移动不触发反应动作。在这次移动中的任意一点，掠食兔进行一次颚齿打击。

Priest Of Kabriri.name: Priest Of Kabriri
Priest Of Kabriri.publicNotes:
A great number of powerful entities have vied for the mantle of patron of the undead, but none of these is more venerated among ghouls than the demon lord @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.deities.V5PbbkZUP9N7kl6h]{Kabriri}, Him Who Gnaws.
