Nearly all ghouls who are inclined to worship gods dedicate themselves to Kabriri, who is honored through profane rituals and macabre ceremonies centered on the gluttonous consumption of sentient beings. Presiding over these liturgies are the priests of Kabriri, particularly vile and cunning ghouls who are specifically tasked by their primogenitor with the duty to ensure his numerous progeny need never go hungry.

Devious and cunning, ghouls can be found anywhere corpses are laid to rest, forever seeking to satisfy their boundless craving for humanoid flesh.

Ecstatic Ululation.name: Ecstatic Ululation
Ecstatic Ululation.description:
触发 A ghoul ally within 30 feet Consumes Flesh to regain Hit Points

效果 The priest of Kabriri unleashes a rapturous howl in praise of their god. All ghouls within 30 feet of the priest of Kabriri, including the priest but not the triggering ghoul, regain half as many Hit Points as the triggering ghoul. All living creatures within 30 feet take negative damage equal to half the number of Hit Points the triggering ghoul gained, with a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:20|basic:true]. Only one Ecstatic Ululation can affect a use of Consume Flesh. Any beyond the first have no effect.

Ghoul Fever.name: Ghoul Fever
Ghoul Fever.description:
豁免检定 @Check[type:fortitude|dc:20]

阶段1 携带但不发病(1天)

阶段2 [[/r {2d6}[negative]]]{2d6负能量伤害} and regains half as many Hit Points from all healing (1天)

阶段3 as stage 2 (1天)

阶段4 [[/r {2d6}[negative]]]{2d6负能量伤害} and gains no benefit from healing (1天)

阶段5 as stage 4 (1天)

阶段6 dead, and rises as a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary.LHHgGSs0ELCR4CYK]{Ghoul} the next midnight.

Paralysis.name: Paralysis
Paralysis.description: Any living, non-elf creature hit by a priest's jaws or claws Strike must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:20] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{麻痹 Paralyzed}. It can attempt a new save at the end of each of its turns, and the DC cumulatively decreases by 1 on each such save.

Swift Leap.name: Swift Leap
Swift Leap.description: The priest jumps up to half its Speed. This movement doesn't trigger reactions.

Prowler Wight.name: Prowler Wight
Prowler Wight.publicNotes:
Often found lurking in the dark, prowler wights wield subterfuge as their greatest weapon. They frequently feign death in old sewers, graveyards, and mausoleums, waiting for hapless victims to pass by before striking.

Wights are undead beings of spite who primarily stalk places related to death.

Final Spite.name: Final Spite
Final Spite.description:
触发 The prowler wight is reduced to 0 Hit Points

效果 The prowler wight makes a Strike before being destroyed. They don't gain any temporary HP from drain life on this Strike.

Drain Life.name: Drain Life
Drain Life.description: When the hunter wight damages a living creature using an unarmed attack or their bound weapon, they gain 9 temporary Hit Points, and the creature must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:25] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1}. Further damage dealt by the hunter wight's unarmed and bound weapon attacks increases the value of the drained condition by 1 on a failed save, to a maximum of drained 4.

Feign Death.name: Feign Death
Feign Death.description: The prowler wight quenches the telltale red glow in their eye sockets, falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{倒地 Prone}, and lies completely still. Until the next time they act, the prowler wight appears to be an ordinary corpse. They have an automatic result of 38 on Deception checks and DCs to pass as an ordinary corpse.

Sneak Attack.name: 偷袭 Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description:
The prowler wight deals an additional 2d6 precision damage to flat-footed creatures.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.SneakAttack]

Spawn Prowler Wight.name: Spawn Prowler Wight
Spawn Prowler Wight.description: A living humanoid killed by a prowler wight's weapon or claw Strike rises as a hunter wight spawn after [[/r 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4轮}. This spawn is under the command of the prowler wight that killed them. They don't have drain life or spawn prowler wight and are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{笨拙 Clumsy 2} for as long as they're a prowler wight spawn. If the creator of the prowler wight spawn dies, the prowler wight spawn becomes a fully autonomous prowler wight; they regain their free will, gain drain life and spawn prowler wight, and are no longer clumsy

Queen Sluagh.name: Queen Sluagh
Queen Sluagh.senses: soulscent (模糊感官) 200 尺, 高等黑暗视觉
Queen Sluagh.publicNotes:
A queen sluagh grows more powerful by devouring souls collected from underlings or drained directly through her proboscis. The muscular tongue inside is tipped with a cartilaginous, barbed quill that feeds the queen not only the soul, but the strengths of its owner. A queen conceals her nest deep in a secluded area, such as a forest or graveyard.

A soul about to leave its physical body gives off a peculiar scent, usually unnoticed by mortal creatures. But the undead fey called sluagh can smell and track down its location with frightening ease. Unlike most fey, sluagh are undead, possessing strong connections to negative energy and mortal souls. Sluagh collect the souls of those close to death and bring them to feed their queen.

Most sluagh appear bald-headed, with rounded ears, sharp teeth, glossy black eyes, and scrawny bodies. Their rib cages show through their skin, which is translucent and soft as velvet.

Sluagh can become ghostly and incorporeal for brief periods. They use this power to stalk their prey to great effect. Sometimes the glimpse of a sluagh is mistaken for a ghost sighting.

Soulscent (Imprecise) 200 feet.name: Soulscent (Imprecise) 200 feet
Soulscent (Imprecise) 200 feet.description: The sluagh is aware of all doomed creatures, dying creatures, and creatures that died within the last hour within the listed range.

Voice of the Soul.name: Voice of the Soul
Voice of the Soul.description: A sluagh queen knows any language of a creature whose soul they've devoured and can perfectly mimic its voice by attempting a Deception check to Lie, with a +4 circumstance bonus.

Call of the Damned.name: Call of the Damned
Call of the Damned.description: The queen sends out shriek to all sluagh within 1 mile, summoning them to her. This typically calls [[/r 2d4]] @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.book-of-the-dead-bestiary.uURI8Netd0ytD9vc]{Sluagh Reapers}. If the queen is facing foes strong enough to threaten her, these are likely too weak to pose a threat but can assist by fetching items or getting in enemies' way.

Eat Soul.name: Eat Soul
Eat Soul.description: The queen touches a dying creature or a creature that died within the past 1 hour with her proboscis. If the target is dying, it must attempt a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:41] save; on a failure, its dying value increases by 2 (3 on a critical failure). If the target is dead, the queen devours the soul. Unless the queen is destroyed, the target can't be returned to life through any means, even powerful magic such as @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.6dDtGIUerazSHIOu]{Wish}.

Ghostly Swoop.name: Ghostly Swoop
Ghostly Swoop.description:
The queen sluagh becomes incorporeal until the start of their next turn, and Flies up to their fly Speed. While incorporeal, they are immune to precision damage, and have resistance 10 to all damage (except force, ghost touch, or positive); this resistance is doubled against non-magical damage.

After using Ghostly Swoop, the queen sluagh can't use it again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge]]{1d4轮}.

Soul Theft.name: Soul Theft
Soul Theft.description:
需求 The queen has a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{擒抱 Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} with her proboscis

效果 The queen devours a portion of the creature's soul and steals some of its ability. The creature takes [[/r {5d8}[negative]]]{5d8负能量伤害} (@Check[type:fortitude|dc:41] save). The queen gains temporary HP equal to the total amount of HP the target loses, including any HP lost from being drained.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes half damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1}.

Failure The creature takes full damage and is drained 1 and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 1}. The queen steals a spell slot or training. If she steals a spell from a prepared caster, she transfers the spell to herself; if she steals from a spontaneous caster, she gains a prepared spell of the appropriate level and expends one of the creature's spell slots of that level. If she steals training, she chooses Perception, attack modifier, or any skill. For 24 hours, she gains a +2 status bonus to that statistic and the creature takes a -2 status penalty. The queen can have any number of stolen abilities, but only one from each creature.

Critical Failure As failure, but double damage.

Raw Nerve.name: Raw Nerve
Raw Nerve.publicNotes:
When a living creature is killed by massive amounts of electricity (such as by being struck by lightning or subjected to a magical attack), their dying terror sometimes causes their soul to linger on the Material Plane. Necromantic energy takes hold of their brain and nervous system, causing these organs to burst forth from the charred flesh and become a raw nerve. These horrific undead float a few inches off the ground in a macabre arrangement morbidly parodying the creature's living form, with its brain at the top and nerves dangling below, crackling with electrical energy.

A raw nerve can sense the thoughts of the living, perceiving them as a chaotic jumble that evokes an uncontrollable rage. The undead seeks to destroy the sources of these thoughts, which often means killing every living creature it can sense. Once a raw nerve detects no more thoughts, it grows still, floating in an almost meditative state. However, its fury instantly reawakens should a thinking creature pass too close. Though it's not mindless, a raw nerve can't be reasoned with, and the only way to stop one is to destroy it.

9nhauoark4hd73ic.name: 思维感知 60 尺
9nhauoark4hd73ic.description: The raw nerve senses all non-mindless creatures at the listed range.

Accelerating Inquest.name: Accelerating Inquest
Accelerating Inquest.description: The raw nerve mentally probes a creature within 100 feet, attempting an @Check[type:occultism] check against the creature's Will DC. On a success, the raw nerve can Step, and gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against that creature until the start of the raw nerve's next turn.

Float.name: Float
Float.description: A raw nerve floats a few inches from the ground. As such, it can ignore difficult terrain.

Involuntary Reaction.name: Involuntary Reaction
Involuntary Reaction.description: A creature struck by a raw nerve's nerve ending strike must succeed at a @Check[type:reflex|dc:26] saving throw or be unable to use reactions until the start of its next turn.

Synaptic Overload.name: Synaptic Overload
Synaptic Overload.description:
The raw nerve releases a burst of mental energy in a @Template[type:cone|distance:30], dealing [[/r {4d12}[mental]]]{4d12 mental伤害} to each creature in the cone (@Check[type:will|dc:23] save).

Critical Success The creature takes no damage.

Success The creature takes half damage.

Failure The creature takes full damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{震慑 Stunned 1}.

Critical Failure The creature takes double damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{震慑 Stunned 2}

Relictner Eroder.name: Relictner Eroder
Relictner Eroder.publicNotes:
Regardless of age, relictners look like ancient dwarves with deep wrinkles, sparse white hair, and decrepit forms. As their bodies degrade, so too do their surroundings, with even the finest architecture crumbling to ruins.

Mortics are humanoids overwhelmed by negative energy who tenaciously cling to life, straddling the line between living and dead.

Consecration Vulnerability.name: Consecration Vulnerability
Consecration Vulnerability.description: A relictner in a place of worship dedicated to a non-evil deity or on sacred ground, such as an area blessed by @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.y3jlOfgsQH1JjkJE]{Sanctified Ground}, is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{缓慢 Slowed 1}.

Lair Sense.name: Lair Sense
Lair Sense.description: The relictner bonds with a single structure they consider their lair, such as a house, temple, or ruin. A relictner is aware of any creature that enters the lair, and the direction and approximate distance to the creature. If the lair is destroyed, the relictner can bond with a new lair by residing within a structure they own or claim for 1 week.

Weathering Aura.name: Weathering Aura
Weathering Aura.description:
@Template[type:emanation|distance:60]{60尺} @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{灵光}

The relictner radiates an aura of degradation. All objects in the area have their Hardness reduced by 10, to a minimum of 0, for as long as they remain in the aura and for 1 round after leaving it. The relictner can't deactivate this aura.

Crumble.name: Crumble
Crumble.description: The relictner erodes an object within 30 feet, dealing [[/r {3d10}[bludgeoning]]]{3d10 bludgeoning伤害} to it, with a @Check[type:reflex|dc:31|basic:true] if the object is attended.

Death Gasp.name: Death Gasp
Death Gasp.description:
The relictner draws in a deep breath and holds it, temporarily suspending their biological processes and becoming undead. The relictner gains the undead trait and becomes immune to bleed, death effects, disease, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{麻痹 Paralyzed}, poison, and sleep. Any such effects the relictner is currently inflicted with are suspended but take effect again once they take a breath.

Death Gasp lasts as long as the relictner holds their breath (up to 12 rounds).

Demolition.name: Demolition
Demolition.description:
The relictner bellows in fury, causing the surrounding structure to collapse. All creatures in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:30] take [[/r {8d10}[bludgeoning]]]{8d10 bludgeoning伤害} from falling debris (@Check[type:reflex|dc:31|basic:true]). A creature that fails its save is knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{倒地 Prone}. The area becomes difficult terrain.

The relictner can't use Demolition again for [[/r 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4轮}.

Runecarved Lich.name: Runecarved Lich
Runecarved Lich.hp: 复生 (as horde lich), 负能量治疗
Runecarved Lich.publicNotes:
In their relentless pursuit of more magical might, some liches use their rotting forms to hold magical secrets, hiding precious tomes in their ribcage, inscribing formulas on their withered flesh, even replacing some bones with powerful magical items. The process is painstaking, as the soul cage tries to repair any damage caused by such alterations.

A desire to live eternally motivates a spellcaster to become a lich, and necromantic knowledge makes the desire real. The typical lich takes the most direct path, keeping their undead form fairly close to their appearance in life. But undeath can also bring greater freedom for those with a less conventional view of what they can become. The horde lich and runecarved lich reshape themselves entirely.

Rejuvenation.name: Rejuvenation
Rejuvenation.description: When a lich is destroyed, its soul immediately transfers to its @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.NEbr7nKuiluJgBHT]{Soul Cage}. A lich can be permanently destroyed only if its soul cage is found and destroyed.

Spellstealing Counter.name: Spellstealing Counter
Spellstealing Counter.description:
触发 A creature the lich can see Casts a Spell

需求 The runecarved lich has fewer than three spells stored in its spell tome

效果 The lich expends a spell slot of the same level as the spell being cast to counter the triggering creature's casting. The runecarved lich loses their spell slot as if they'd cast the triggering spell. The lich then attempts to counteract the triggering spell (counteract modifier [[/r 1d20+35#Counteract]]{+35}). If successful, the spell is countered and added to the runecarved lich's spell tome.

Stored Items.name: Stored Items
Stored Items.description:
The runecarved lich can store items inside its body, as detailed below. The lich can Interact to remove or store an item. If the lich's body is destroyed, any stored items appear among their bones.

  • Arm Wands (extradimensional) The runecarved lich can store up to two wands in the radius and ulna of one of their arms. These wands can be used as if wielded, and they can't be disarmed. If an arm wand is overcharged, the lich takes 20 damage if the wand is broken or 40 if it's destroyed.
  • Spell Tome A runecarved lich has a carefully crafted tome, filled with magical power, placed inside their ribcage. This tome can hold up to three spells stolen by the Spellstealing Counter ability.
  • Stored Weapon (extradimensional)The lich can store a single one-handed weapon of 1 Bulk or less, linked to special runes carved into the bones of one of the lich's arms. This runecarved lich has the battle axe listed in its items, but a different individual might have a different weapon. A weapon the lich wields deals additional damage equal to half the number of dice from its hand attack.

Consult the Text.name: Consult the Text
Consult the Text.description:
频率 每天一次

效果 The runecarved lich causes the pages of their spell tome to flip open, revealing an occult spell of 9th level or lower of their choice. For the remainder of the day, the lich can cast that spell as if it were one of their spells known for every level from its base level up to 9th.

Drain Spell Tome.name: Drain Spell Tome
Drain Spell Tome.description: 效果 The lich draws upon the magic stored in their spell tome to cast one of the spells they've countered. This spell is the same level as the one countered, but it uses the runecarved lich's spell DC and spell attack. Casting a spell in this way removes it from the spell tome.

Steady Spellcasting.name: Steady Spellcasting
Steady Spellcasting.description: If a reaction would disrupt the runecarved lich's spellcasting action, the lich attempts a @Check[type:flat|dc:15]. On a success, the action isn't disrupted.

Summon Weapon.name: Summon Weapon
Summon Weapon.description:
需求 The lich has a stored weapon in its arm and has that hand free

效果 The runecarved lich summons its stored weapon into that arm's hand.

Sadistic Conductor.name: Sadistic Conductor
Sadistic Conductor.disable: @Check[type:perfomance|dc:18] to perform so well the conductor releases you from your instrument, banishing it voluntarily; @Check[type:occultism|dc:22] (trained) or @Check[type:religion|dc:22] (trained) to banish one instrument; or @Check[type:thievery|dc:25] (trained) to sabotage one instrument; each instrument must be banished, sabotaged, or destroyed to disable the haunt
Sadistic Conductor.hazarddescription: A phantom conductor appears with a flourish, causing spectral instruments with razor-like strings to appear in the hands of those present. As the conductor gestures for the performance to begin, creatures are compelled to play the instruments.
Sadistic Conductor.reset: The haunt deactivates when all conjured instruments are destroyed or there has been silence for 1 minute. It resets after 1 hour.
Sadistic Conductor.routine: (1 action; enchantment, mental, occult) The conductor urges each creature within 30 feet to play the hazardous instrument it holds. Each creature that is compelled to play its instrument does so, and those who succeeded on their save can choose to do so. Playing the instrument, either from the haunt's routine or of a creature's own volition during an attempt to disable the haunt, deals [[/r {1d6+3}[slashing]]]{1d6+3挥砍伤害} (@Check[type:reflex|dc:21|basic:true|traits:enchantment,mental,occult] save), and the creature must attempt a @Check[type:performance|dc:18|traits:enchantment,mental,occult,damaging-effect] check. On a success, the conductor accepts the performance and dismisses that creature's instrument, and on a critical failure, the discordant sound and conductor's jeers deal an additional [[/r {1d6+3}[sonic]]]{1d6+3 sonic伤害}.

Conjure Instruments.name: Conjure Instruments
Conjure Instruments.description:
触发 A creature approaches within 15 feet

效果 The conductor conjures a hazardous spectral instrument into the hands of each sentient creature within 30 feet. Even a creature whose hands are full finds a spectral instrument superimposed over the other items it's carrying. Affected creatures must each attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:19] save. The haunt then rolls initiative.

Critical Success The conjuration fails and no instrument appears in the creature's hands.

Success A conjured instrument appears in the creature's hands, but it isn't compelled to play it.

Failure A conjured instrument appears in the creature's hands and it's compelled to play it. The creature can't willingly put down the instrument while compelled to play.

Critical Failure As failure, but the creature needs a critical success on its Performance in order for the conductor to be satisfied and dismiss its instrument.

Scorned Hound.name: 受嗤猎犬 Scorned Hound
Scorned Hound.senses: 感知伙伴, 灵敏嗅觉 (模糊感官) 30 尺, 黑暗视觉
Scorned Hound.publicNotes:
受嗤猎犬复活自那些最忠诚的猎犬，它们对主人有着难以置信的占有欲，不允许任何生物接近，并拒绝与主人分开。

超越死亡继续延续的忠诚纽带唤起宠物，它们在死后几天内从坟墓里爬出，回到过去的主人、家庭或族群身边。不幸的是，死亡不可逆转地改变了复生宠物。他们返回时成为具有攻击性的掠食性野兽，难以控制，容易发怒。即使是最友好的动物，在死后也会变得嗜虐且暴力——它们会首先将这可怕的性子用在它们眼中争夺主人注意力的生物上。而当复生宠物被主人抛弃、拒绝或冒犯时，它们的怒火就会转向主人。

Sense Companion.name: 感知伙伴 Sense Companion
Sense Companion.description: 一只受嗤猎犬永远知道它生前所属主人或家庭的方向（只要他俩处于同一位面），但不知道距离。

Stench.name: 恶臭 Stench
Stench.description:
@Template[type:emanation|distance:15]{15尺} @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{灵光}

进入灵光或在灵光中开始回合的生物必须成功通过@Check[type:fortitude|dc:14]豁免，否则获得@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 1}（若大失败，则只要该生物还恶心，就会额外获得@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{缓慢 Slowed 1}。身处灵光范围内时，受影响的生物在对抗疾病的豁免和从恶心中恢复的检定上受到-2环境减值。豁免成功的生物临时免疫本能力1分钟。

Betray the Pack.name: 背叛族群 Betray the Pack
Betray the Pack.description: 猎犬的攻击对曾经是它的主人、伙伴、同行的宠物、家庭、家园或族群的生物造成[[/r {1d4}[precision]]]{1d4额外伤害}。

Seetangeist.name: Seetangeist
Seetangeist.publicNotes:
Seetangeists are composed of the bloated corpses of marine life, encrusted with bleached coral and wrapped in rotting seaweed. Although occasionally created by water-breathing necromancers, seetangeists most often arise when an aquatic ecosystem collapses, resulting in the deaths of countless creatures. Bound by spiritual trauma, these corpses merge together, forming a writhing school of flesh and decaying plant matter that seeks out and consumes what life remains in the region.

The disasters that lead to the creation of seetangeists are typically caused by mortal interference: overhunting, ecological overexploitation, pollution, or necromantic magic and experimentation.

When disaster befalls the natural world, a different kind of undead may rise, entirely unlike risen humanoids. Most plants, fish, insects, and other animals don't possess a psychology complex enough to experience the emotional catharsis required to return as undead without intervention from an outside force. Mass extinction can serve as that outside force.

Humanoids clear-cutting an entire forest or a seaside community wiping out a species critical to their ecosystem can spawn a verdorite. The collective spiritual energy and emotional distress of a dying biome powers these undead, formed as conglomerates or representatives.

Necrotic Runoff.name: Necrotic Runoff
Necrotic Runoff.description:
@Template[type:emanation|distance:60] @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{灵光}

A seetangeist secretes foul fluids into the surrounding water, poisoning it. A creature that enters or starts its turn in the aura must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:29] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 2} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 3} on a critical failure). Creatures that breathe water take a -2 circumstance penalty to this saving throw. As long as a creature remains in the aura, it can't reduce its sickened condition below 1. A creature that succeeds at its save is temporarily immune for 1 minute.

Putrid Assault.name: Putrid Assault
Putrid Assault.description: Each enemy in the seetangeist's space takes [[/r {3d6}[slashing]+{3d6}[poison]]]{3d6 slashing and 3d6 poison伤害} (@Check[type:reflex|dc:32|basic:true]). A creature that fails this save also takes @Localize[PF2E.PersistentDamage.Poison1d12.success].

Shadern Immolator.name: Shadern Immolator
Shadern Immolator.publicNotes:
Goblin mortics have blackened, charred flesh and smoldering burns all over their body, as if they'd been burned alive. They are highly flammable but inured to the pain, and they enjoy lighting themselves (and everything else) on fire.

Mortics are humanoids overwhelmed by negative energy who tenaciously cling to life, straddling the line between living and dead.

Consecration Vulnerability.name: Consecration Vulnerability
Consecration Vulnerability.description: A shadern in a place of worship dedicated to a non-evil deity or on sacred ground, such as an area blessed by @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.y3jlOfgsQH1JjkJE]{Sanctified Ground}, is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{缓慢 Slowed 1}.

Smoke Vision.name: Smoke Vision
Smoke Vision.description: The shadern ignores the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{隐蔽 Concealed} condition from smoke.

Death Gasp.name: Death Gasp
Death Gasp.description:
The shadern draws in a deep breath and holds it, temporarily suspending their biological processes and becoming undead. The shadern gains the undead trait and becomes immune to bleed, death effects, disease, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{麻痹 Paralyzed}, poison, and sleep. Any such effects the shadern is currently inflicted with are suspended but take effect again once they take a breath.

Death Gasp lasts as long as the shadern holds their breath (up to 8 rounds).

Exhale.name: Exhale
Exhale.description: The shadern exhales a cloud of thick smoke in a @Template[type:burst|distance:10]{10-foot burst} centered on them. The cloud remains in place for [[/r 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4轮}. All creatures within the smoke become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{隐蔽 Concealed}, and all creatures outside the smoke become concealed to creatures within it. Exhaling ends Death Gasp, as the shadern ceases holding their breath.

Smoldering Fist.name: Smoldering Fist
Smoldering Fist.description: On a critical hit, the shadern immolator's fist Strike also deals [[/r {1d4}[persistent,fire]]] @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.lDVqvLKA6eF3Df60]{Persistent fire伤害}.

Shattered Window.name: Shattered Window
Shattered Window.disable: @Check[type:occultism|dc:19|name:Suppress the Spiritual Energy] or @Check[type:religion|dc:19|name:Suppress the Spiritual Energy] (trained) to suppress the spiritual energy or @Check[type:diplomacy|dc:20|name:Soothe the Latent Anger] (trained) to soothe the latent anger
Shattered Window.hazarddescription: The anger trapped within a structure shatters a window, showering glass in adjacent spaces.
Shattered Window.stealthdetails: (trained) to notice cracks spider-webbing across the window

Shatter.name: Shatter
Shatter.description:
触发 A creature moves adjacent to the window

效果 The window shatters, dealing [[/r {2d6+5}[slashing]]]{2d6+5挥砍伤害} to creatures within 5 feet (@Check[type:reflex|dc:17|basic:true]).

Shredskin.name: Shredskin
Shredskin.publicNotes: Shredskins are flying, flapping animate skins who wander the lands lamenting their fate and feeling hollow and adrift, as if they're missing something crucial inside them. They try to enshroud and seize humanoid bodies—either corpses or living creatures, anything to fill that void within themselves. Though many will take any body they can overpower, some know who created them and desire only that body to claim as their own, the truest fulfillment of their accursed nature. Shredskins come from people skinned as inhumane trophies, or who were killed in a gruesome way that left only their skin intact, such as being pulled into a machine and degloved.

Compression.name: Compression
Compression.description: When a shredskin successfully @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.kMcV8e5EZUxa6evt]{Squeezes}, it moves through the tight space at full speed. Narrow confines are not difficult terrain for a shredskin.

Control Body.name: Control Body
Control Body.description:
需求 The shredskin is in the same space as a Medium or Small humanoid-shaped corpse

效果 The shredskin wraps itself around the corpse as a new skin and takes control of the host body. While controlling a host, the shredskin uses the host's Speed but its own attacks, and it loses its Grab and Enshroud abilities. Attacks that target the shredskin while it controls a body deal half of the damage to the shredskin and half of the damage to the host body. Attacks that target an area deal damage to both the shredskin and host body normally. The shredskin can release the host body as a free action at the start of its turn. If the host is destroyed, the shredskin automatically releases the body and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{措手不及 Flat-Footed} for 1 round. A Medium corpse typically has 15 Hit Points, while a Small corpse typically has 10 Hit Points. Creatures can notice that a corpse is controlled by a shredskin by succeeding at a Perception check against the shredskin's Deception DC (typically 18).

Enshroud.name: Enshroud
Enshroud.description:
需求 The shredskin is restraining a creature

效果 The shredskin wraps itself around the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} creature like a shirt, seizing control. The shredskin rolls an @Check[type:athletics] check against the creature's Fortitude DC. On a success, the creature becomes restrained until it Escapes and the shredskin can control the creature as described in Control Body. At the start of each of its turns, the shredskin can attempt to Constrict the enshrouded creature as a free action. An enshrouded creature can attempt a DC 16 Escape check to break free (DC 18 if the shredskin critically succeeded its Athletics check to Enshroud).

Siabrae.name: Siabrae
Siabrae.publicNotes:
A siabrae is a determined and merciless foe, bound by a twisted sense of duty to nature so strong that it drove them to commit unspeakable acts and arise as an undead menace.

A siabrae is an abomination. A skeletal druid or wild witch, with bones the texture of stone and antlers of rock rising from their rough skulls, they're people who have willingly paid the ultimate price to protect the natural world. It rarely goes well for them.

Druids and wild witches protect Golarion's environment from a host of threats—demonic invasions and undead horrors, otherworldly corruptions, and mundane greed and cupidity. Sometimes, they're tested beyond what they can bear, faced with forces they're incapable of defeating. Such a druid, seeing everything they have protected fall to destruction, might try the unthinkable. They might perform the ritual known as Welcome the Blighted Soul.

With desperate prayer and a gory blood sacrifice, the druid becomes a siabrae, taking the corruption of the land into themself and binding both together, so they might survive and fight monsters in nature's service. A small few are able to use their newfound power to save their lands, and so the ritual's legend grows. Much more often, the druid becomes a twisted guardian of something past saving, the land they protect a macabre parody of healthy nature. Most siabraes are proud and bitter, obsessed with duty and branding their living brethren as cowards and traitors.

Rejuvenation.name: Rejuvenation
Rejuvenation.description: When a siabrae is destroyed, they can attempt a @Check[type:flat|dc:10] (they automatically succeed if they're standing on blighted or diseased terrain, and automatically fail if they're standing on sacred ground). If the flat check succeeds, the siabrae's body crumbles to dust and absorbs into the earth. After [[/r 1d10 #days]]{1d10 days}, the siabrae's body reforms from a mass of unworked stone large enough to create a new body; this stone is in a random location within 1d10 miles of where the siabrae was destroyed. The siabrae emerges from the stone with a peal of thunder, though without any of their gear.

Blight Mastery.name: Blight Mastery
Blight Mastery.description: Any of the siabrae's spells or effects that would normally be restricted to affecting animals can also affect undead animals. Furthermore, any animals the siabrae takes the form of or summons appear to be diseased, malnourished, or even dead and rotting. (This doesn't affect their statistics.)

Steady Spellcasting.name: Steady Spellcasting
Steady Spellcasting.description: If a reaction would disrupt the siabrae's spellcasting action, the siabrae attempts a @Check[type:flat|dc:15]. On a success, the action isn't disrupted.

Stony Shards.name: Stony Shards
Stony Shards.description: Tiny shards break off the siabrae's antlers when they attack, lodging in the target's wounds and inflicting a terrible curse. A creature damaged by a siabrae's stone antlers Strike must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:37] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{笨拙 Clumsy 2} for [[/r 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4轮} on a failure. If the creature critically fails, or fails while already clumsy 2 or greater, the creature is petrified.

Silent Stalker.name: Silent Stalker
Silent Stalker.publicNotes:
When a person is betrayed and killed in a way that their voice was silenced (such as through strangulation by a lover or close confidante), they might come back as a silent stalker. A silent stalker is a horrifying, twisted likeness of the person they were in life, with one obvious difference: the silent stalker has no mouth, simply a smooth patch of flesh where a mouth should be. Sound is suppressed in an area around a silent stalker, but once someone notices the quiet, it's often too late.

A revenant is a vengeful undead who stalks the one who killed them in life. They're relentless in the pursuit of their murderer, seeking a final justice.

Self-Loathing.name: Self-Loathing
Self-Loathing.description:
If a silent stalker sees their own reflection or any object important to them in life, they must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:33] save.

Critical Success The pale stranger is unaffected and can no longer be affected by that reflection or object in this way.

Success The silent stalker is distracted by self-loathing and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{缓慢 Slowed 1} for 1 round.

Failure The silent stalker becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg]{Fascinated} by the source of their self-loathing and does everything they can to destroy it until the end of their next turn.

Critical Failure The silent stalker becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} as long as the source of their self-loathing is apparent, until they're attacked, or until they see their murderer.

Sense Murderer.name: Sense Murderer
Sense Murderer.description: A silent stalker knows the direction of their murderer (as long as both are on the same plane), but not the distance.

Silent Aura.name: Silent Aura
Silent Aura.description:
@Template[type:emanation|distance:10]{10尺} @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{灵光}

A silent stalker makes no sound, preventing creatures from noticing them using hearing or a similar sense alone. This silence stops all sound within it or passing through. The silent stalker and all creatures in the aura can't use sonic attacks or actions that have the auditory trait; this prevents creatures from casting spells with verbal components or activating items with command components.

Undying Vendetta.name: Undying Vendetta
Undying Vendetta.description: If the silent stalker's murderer dies, the pale stranger is immediately destroyed. A pale stranger that can't sense their murderer must attempt a @Check[type:flat|dc:11] once every 24 hours to avoid becoming @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized}和@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{倒地 Prone}; they immediately rise again once they can sense their murderer. A murderer who becomes undead does not trigger the silent stalker's destruction until the murderer is finally destroyed. The silent stalker gains a +2 status bonus to checks and DCs against their murderer.

Implacable Advance.name: Implacable Advance
Implacable Advance.description: The silent stalker Strides twice and makes a claw Strike; they can ignore difficult terrain during these Strides if they advance toward their murderer. If they Strike and Grab their murderer this turn, they can Constrict as a free action immediately after the Grab.

Siphoning Spirit.name: Siphoning Spirit
Siphoning Spirit.disable: @Check[type:occultism|dc:48] (expert) or @Check[type:religion|dc:48] (expert) to weaken the spirit; four total successes are required to disable the haunt
Siphoning Spirit.hazarddescription: A formless spirit drains life from the living, becoming progressively visible as its victims weaken.
Siphoning Spirit.reset: After 1 minute, the spirit is satiated, and the haunt deactivates as it returns to a resting state. Over the course of 1 hour, the spirit's siphoned life energy disperses and the haunt resets.
Siphoning Spirit.routine:
(1 action; death, divine, necromancy, negative) The spirit inhales, siphoning the souls of the living and becoming more visible. Each creature within @Template[type:burst|distnace:60]{60尺} takes [[/r {4d10+20}[negative]]]{4d10+20负能量伤害}, with a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:41|traits:death,divine,necromancy,negative,damaging-effect] save. If no creatures are within the area, the haunt moves up to 120 feet into the largest concentration of living creatures and then inhales.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes half damage.

Failure The creature takes full damage and increases its @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained} value by 1, to a maximum of drained 4.

Critical Failure The creature takes double damage and increases its drained value by 2, to a maximum of drained 4. If the creature was already drained 4, it dies.

Sudden Siphon.name: Sudden Siphon
Sudden Siphon.description:
触发 A living creature passes within 15 feet of the spirit

效果 The invisible spirit latches onto the life essence of the living, dealing [[/r {4d10+20}[negative]]]{4d10+20负能量伤害} to all living creatures within @Template[type:burst|distance:60]{60尺} (@Check[type:fortitude|dc:41|basic:true] save). The haunt then rolls initiative.

Skeletal Mage.name: 骷髅法师 Skeletal Mage
Skeletal Mage.publicNotes:
在罕见的情况下，一名施法者的遗骨能被用来制作一个保留了部分施法能力的骷髅。它还能施展的法术几乎全是攻击性法术，而骷髅法师则毫无顾忌地施展它们。骷髅法师常被误认为巫妖，虽然它们没有巫妖那么狡猾或致命，但它们仍能对它们的敌人构成重大威胁。

在亡者的行列中，没有哪种不死有着如骷髅一般无穷的数量与种类。虽然大多数骷髅几乎完全由骨头构成，但少部分还保留着一些肉屑来帮助它们运动，比如翼膜。

Skeletal Soldier.name: 骷髅士兵 Skeletal Soldier
Skeletal Soldier.publicNotes:
这些士兵在死后继续服从命令，仍旧挥舞着它们花了一生时间学习使用的军备。虽然它们常由人类与矮人的骨骼制成，以其他类人生物为原料的骷髅士兵也很常见，例如熊地精、大地精还有兽。通常，这些士兵会拿着它们生前种族中最常见的武器，而非下面数据中列出的。

在亡者的行列中，没有哪种不死有着如骷髅一般无穷的数量与种类。虽然大多数骷髅几乎完全由骨头构成，但少部分还保留着一些肉屑来帮助它们运动，比如翼膜。

Set Defense.name: 设防 Set Defense
Set Defense.description: 骷髅士兵架好它的大砍刀（或其他触及武器）来保卫它周围的区域。它获得仅限该武器使用的@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.hFtNbo1LKYCoDy2O]{借机攻击 Attack of Opportunity}反应动作。这将持续到骷髅士兵使用带有移动或攻击特征的动作或它被摧毁。

Skeletal Titan.name: 骷髅泰坦 Skeletal Titan
Skeletal Titan.publicNotes:
只有强大但又愚蠢的家伙才会将伟岸的泰坦或类似的巨型生物复活为骷髅。技艺娴熟的实践者认为这是在浪费一具强大的遗体，并根据泰坦的身躯为它们注入了空中行走的魔法；而聪明的人则知道控制这样一个巨无霸几乎不可能，而且它也很有可能在剁扁敌人时把它的创造者压在它硕大的脚下。

在亡者的行列中，没有哪种不死有着如骷髅一般无穷的数量与种类。虽然大多数骷髅几乎完全由骨头构成，但少部分还保留着一些肉屑来帮助它们运动，比如翼膜。

Bone Debris.name: 巨骨残片 Bone Debris
Bone Debris.description: 骷髅泰坦投掷的骨头大到足以扰乱战场。当骷髅泰坦用巨骨攻击命中一个生物时，投掷物在该生物占据的方格（如果该生物占据的方格多于一个，则由泰坦选择其中一个）成为困难地形。如果泰坦的巨骨攻击没有命中，与该生物相邻的一个随机方格就会变成困难地形。

Mountain Slam.name: 山劈 Mountain Slam
Mountain Slam.description: 骷髅泰坦将它的山岳巨剑砸向地面。冲击波回荡，对@Template[type:line|distance:20]范围内的所有生物造成山岳巨剑打击伤害（@Check[type:reflex|dc:34|basic:true]豁免）。豁免失败的生物还会被击至@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{倒地 Prone}。

Sluagh Reaper.name: Sluagh Reaper
Sluagh Reaper.senses: soulscent (模糊感官) 100 尺, 高等黑暗视觉
Sluagh Reaper.publicNotes:
Most sluagh are reapers: powerful killers subservient to their queen. After they collect souls on a hunt, they dutifully return their plunder to the queen. Though quite clever, they're inscrutable, lacking the whimsy and sociability that characterize many living fey. They do show merriment on occasion though, giggling as their claws draw closer to their quarry's throat.

A soul about to leave its physical body gives off a peculiar scent, usually unnoticed by mortal creatures. But the undead fey called sluagh can smell and track down its location with frightening ease. Unlike most fey, sluagh are undead, possessing strong connections to negative energy and mortal souls. Sluagh collect the souls of those close to death and bring them to feed their queen.

Most sluagh appear bald-headed, with rounded ears, sharp teeth, glossy black eyes, and scrawny bodies. Their rib cages show through their skin, which is translucent and soft as velvet.

Sluagh can become ghostly and incorporeal for brief periods. They use this power to stalk their prey to great effect. Sometimes the glimpse of a sluagh is mistaken for a ghost sighting.

Soulscent (Imprecise) 100 feet.name: Soulscent (Imprecise) 100 feet
Soulscent (Imprecise) 100 feet.description: The sluagh is aware of all @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed} creatures, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.yZRUzMqrMmfLu0V1]{Dying} creatures, and creatures that died within the last hour within the listed range.

Ghostly Swoop.name: Ghostly Swoop
Ghostly Swoop.description:
The sluagh reaper becomes incorporeal until the start of their next turn, and Flies up to their fly Speed. While incorporeal, they are immune to precision damage, and have resistance 10 to all damage (except force, ghost touch, or positive); this resistance is doubled against non-magical damage.

After using Ghostly Swoop, the sluagh reaper can't use it again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge]]{1d4轮}.

Sneak Attack.name: 偷袭 Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description:
The sluagh reaper deals an additional 3d6 precision damage to flat-footed creatures.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.SneakAttack]

Steal Soul.name: Steal Soul
Steal Soul.description:
The sluagh reaper touches a dying creature or a creature that died within the past 1 hour. If the target is a dying creature, it must attempt a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:28] save-on a failure, its dying value increases by 1 (2 on a critical failure). If the target is dead, it receives no save and the sluagh imprisons its soul in a small, grimy sack that keeps stolen souls fresh.

The sack is magically locked. Any sluagh can open it without difficulty, but any others must @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.2EE4aF4SZpYf0R6H]{Pick the Lock} (@Check[type:thievery|dc:35|traits:action:pick-a-lock]) or use @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (5th level; counteract DC 32). A creature can Interact to empty an unlocked sack, which frees the souls but doesn't return them to life. While a soul is imprisoned, it can't be brought back to life by any means short of a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.6dDtGIUerazSHIOu]{Wish} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.YfJTXyVGzLhM6V8U]{Miracle}. The sack can hold 12 souls at a time. Sluagh reapers typically attempt to return the souls to a queen so she can devour them.

Spirit Cyclone.name: Spirit Cyclone
Spirit Cyclone.disable: @Check[type:occultism|dc:30] (trained) or @Check[type:religion|dc:30] (trained) to weaken the haunt; three total successes in any combination are required to disable the haunt
Spirit Cyclone.hazarddescription: A cyclone of angry spirits surges around the area.
Spirit Cyclone.reset: The spirit cyclone disperses after 1 minute and resets after 1 day.
Spirit Cyclone.routine: (3 actions) The spirit cyclone uses 3 actions to move, traveling up to 30 feet with each action and dealing [[/r {2d10+13}[negative]]]{2d10+13负能量伤害} to each creature in its path (@Check[type:reflex|dc:32|basic:true] save). A creature needs to attempt only one save during the cyclone's movement, even if the cyclone moves over its space more than once. On a critical failure, a creature is swept up into the cyclone, becoming @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{擒抱 Grabbed} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape} DC 32). A creature grabbed by the cyclone moves along with the cyclone and takes [[/r {1d10+6}[negative]]]{1d10+6 additional负能量伤害} at their beginning of its turn, and it must attempt a Reflex save against the cyclone on the cyclone's turn, no matter where the cyclone moves. A creature that successfully Escapes from the cyclone falls from a height of [[/r {1d12*5} #Falling Distance]]{1d12 x 5尺}.

Gather Spirit.name: Gather Spirit
Gather Spirit.description:
触发 Two or more creatures enter the area

效果 A spiraling column of spirits gather, becoming a whirling cyclone of souls @Template[type:burst|distance:5]{10 feet wide} and 60 feet tall. The haunt then rolls initiative.

Sykever.name: Sykever
Sykever.publicNotes:
The most common darvakkas are sykevers, walkers in the night. Bloodthirsty but calculating, they lead legions of dead into battle on the Material Plane, working toward the simple goal of ending all life.

Darvakkas, also called nightshades, are a ravenous evil made up of equal parts darkness and malice. Originally creatures of the Outer Planes who travel to the convergence of the Shadow Plane and the Negative Energy Plane—where the power of nothingness obliterates them—these undead abominations are the physical embodiment of entropy. They burn with an intense hatred for all life, working to bring a final, dark night to the Material Plane where nothing but ash and ice remain.

As creatures twisted by darkness and shadow, darvakkas have a great aversion to sunlight and all sources of positive energy. On the Material Plane, they spend the hours of daylight hidden below ground, amid ruins, or submerged deep in the ocean's darkest chasms beyond the reach of the sun's rays, emerging when darkness shelters them overhead.

Darvakkas have an aura of entropy that attracts undead thralls to serve as warriors and heralds. They rarely seek alliances with each other or other creatures, existing in solitude as the heads of individual armies of the dead.

Entropy's Shadow.name: Entropy's Shadow
Entropy's Shadow.description:
@Template[type:emanation|distance:40]{40尺} @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{灵光}

Sykevers leak entropy and corruption from their very being. A living creature entering or starting its turn in the aura takes [[/r {4d6}[negative]]]{4d6负能量伤害} with a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:33|basic:true]. If it fails, it's also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} for 1 minute and pulled 10 feet toward the sykever.

Sunlight Powerlessness.name: Sunlight Powerlessness
Sunlight Powerlessness.description: A sykever caught in sunlight is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{震慑 Stunned 2}和@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{笨拙 Clumsy 2}.

Change Posture.name: Change Posture
Change Posture.description: The sykever changes between their bipedal and quadrupedal stance. In their bipedal stance, the sykever can use all the abilities in their stat block except Horned Rush. In their quadrupedal stance, the sykever has a Speed of 80 feet but can't make arm spike Strikes, Disarm, cast spells, or use Crush Item.

Crush Item.name: Crush Item
Crush Item.description:
触发 The sykever gets a critical success to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Dt6B1slsBy8ipJu9]{Disarm}

需求 The sykever is in their bipedal stance

效果 The sykever snatches the item and pierces it with their arm spikes. The item becomes broken and falls to the ground in the sykever's space. Items that are already broken aren't further damaged, and an item with 14 or higher Hardness is unaffected.

Draining Gaze.name: Draining Gaze
Draining Gaze.description:
The sykever fixes their nightmarish gaze on one creature they can see, who must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:36] save. Regardless of the result, the target is temporarily immune for 10 minutes.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} for 1 round if the sykever is in bipedal stance, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{笨拙 Clumsy 2} for 1 round if the sykever is in quadrupedal stance.

Failure As success, but the effect lasts 1 minute.

Critical Failure As success, but @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 3} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{笨拙 Clumsy 3}, and the effect lasts 10 minutes.

Horned Rush.name: Horned Rush
Horned Rush.description:
需求 The sykever is in their quadrupedal stance

效果 The sykever Strides and then makes a horn Strike.

Taunting Skull.name: Taunting Skull
Taunting Skull.publicNotes:
Some beheaded are raised with their mental faculties mostly intact. These clever undead often provoke their victims into foolishly giving chase or harming themselves.

Beheaded are disembodied floating heads transformed into undead. They are natural candidates for a necromancer's "project minion," due to the inexpensive cost of creation and endlessly customizable nature. In any lair occupied for long by practicing necromancers, it isn't uncommon to find a handful of floating heads roaming about, each exhibiting completely different characteristics and even degrees of expertise in their creation.

Bite Back.name: Bite Back
Bite Back.description:
触发 The taunting skull is attacked by a creature within their reach

效果 The taunting skull makes a jaws Strike against that creature.

Incessant Goading.name: Incessant Goading
Incessant Goading.description:
The skull chooses one creature within 60 feet and antagonizes it mercilessly. The target must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:22] save to resist the effect.

Critical Success The target is unaffected and is temporarily immune for 1 minute.

Success The target is unaffected.

Failure The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{措手不及 Flat-Footed} for 1 round. On its next turn, if the taunting skull is within the target's reach, the target wildly attacks the taunting skull as many times as possible.

Critical Failure As failure, but the target also immediately performs a Strike against itself; this Strike doesn't take any actions.

Toppling Furniture.name: Toppling Furniture
Toppling Furniture.disable: @Check[type:athletics|dc:16|name:Hold the furniture upright] to hold the furniture upright or @Check[type:occultism|dc:18|name:Foil the spirit's influence] (trained) to foil the spirit's efforts to influence matter
Toppling Furniture.hazarddescription: A mischievous spirit pushes a bookshelf over onto a creature.
Toppling Furniture.reset: If the haunt successfully damages a creature with Topple Furniture, the spirit laughs for [[/br 1d4 #Laughing Duration]]{1d4轮} as the haunt resets; each subsequent time the haunt activates, it must topple a different piece of upright furniture. If the haunt fails to damage a creature, the spirit wails in frustration and resets after pouting for [[/br 1d4 #Haunt Reset]]{1d4 hours}.
Toppling Furniture.stealthdetails: (trained) to hear the spirit's grunt of exertion as it works to topple the furniture

Topple Furniture.name: Topple Furniture
Topple Furniture.description:
触发 A creature moves adjacent to the furniture

效果 The spirit shoves the furniture over in an attempt to crush the triggering creature. The triggering creature takes [[/r {2d10+7}[bludgeoning]]]{2d10+7 bludgeoning伤害} (@Check[type:reflex|dc:22|basic:true]). On a failure, the creature is additionally knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{倒地 Prone}.

Tormented (Burning).name: Tormented (Burning)
Tormented (Burning).publicNotes: Twisted caricatures of living beings, tormented arise from the remains of those who've been tortured to death. They appear as the mortals they were in life, horribly disfigured by acts of cruelty. Unable to rest, they haunt the sites of their deaths, doomed to relive their last moments of agony. The toxic psychic residue of their death is so great it spills over, afflicting anyone who meets the tormented's haunted gaze.

Endless Suffering.name: Endless Suffering
Endless Suffering.description: The tormented perished by fire and brand.

Tortured Gaze.name: Tortured Gaze
Tortured Gaze.description:
@Template[type:emanation|distance:30] @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{灵光} or @Template[type:emanation|distance:60] if the tormented is at 125 HP or lower.

The psychic agony of a tormented spills into the world around them, inflicting murderous hallucinations replicating the tormented's last moments. A non-undead creature that ends its turn in the aura must succeed at a @Check[type:will|dc:32] save or take [[/r {6d6}[fire]]]{6d6 fire伤害} and be wreathed in ghostly flames for 1 minute, negating its @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{隐蔽 Concealed} condition and rendering it concealed if it would be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{Invisible}. While it has a condition from Tortured Gaze, a creature can't gain a new condition from the aura but can take damage from it again.

Scream in Agony.name: Scream in Agony
Scream in Agony.description:
Each creature in the tormented's Tortured Gaze aura takes [[/r {14d6}[mental]]]{14d6 mental伤害} (@Check[type:will|dc:34|basic:true]). A creature that fails is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 1} (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 2} on a critical failure).

The tormented can't Scream in Agony again for [[/br 1d4 #Scream in Agony Recharge]]{1d4轮}, but recharges the ability whenever they take damage from an attacker's critical hit or their own critical failure on a saving throw.

Tormented (Crushing).name: Tormented (Crushing)
Tormented (Crushing).publicNotes: Twisted caricatures of living beings, tormented arise from the remains of those who've been tortured to death. Each creature in the tormented's Tortured Gaze aura takes [[/r {14d6}[mental]]]{14d6 mental伤害} (@Check[type:will|dc:34|basic:true]). A creature that fails is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 1} (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 2} on a critical failure).

The tormented can't Scream in Agony again for [[/br 1d4 #Scream in Agony Recharge]]{1d4轮}, but recharges the ability whenever they take damage from an attacker's critical hit or their own critical failure on a saving throw.

Unrisen.name: Unrisen
Unrisen.hp: meant to live, 负能量治疗
Unrisen.publicNotes:
An unrisen is a mangled conglomeration of splintered bones, decaying organs, and rotting flesh, created when a ritual such as resurrect goes catastrophically wrong. Immense care must be taken, for if the ritual is a critical failure, an unrisen can be the result—as many a ritualist has learned to their horror.

Unrisen are barely intelligent, aware only of the agony constantly inflicted by their flawed creation and their resentment for the living. They tend to attack the casters involved in the botched ritual first before lashing out at everyone else around them. Though an unrisen's twisted form is unrecognizable as the intended target of the resurrection, its wordless howls are often disturbingly similar to the deceased's voice. If an unrisen is destroyed before it can rise again, it's reduced to a handful of metallic blue-green salts referred to as essential salts.

Meant to Live.name: Meant to Live
Meant to Live.description: Whenever an unrisen would take damage from positive energy, it instead heals half that number of Hit Points.

Resurrection Vulnerability.name: Resurrection Vulnerability
Resurrection Vulnerability.description: A creature with a prepared or spontaneous spell that can restore the dead to life (such as @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Hnc7eGi7vyZenAIm]{Breath of Life} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.IkGYwHRLhkuoGReG]{Raise Dead}) can expend an appropriate spell slot as a 2-action activity to destroy an unrisen within 30 feet. The attempt fails if the unrisen succeeds at a Will save against the creature's spell DC.

Rise Again.name: Rise Again
Rise Again.description: If the unrisen is reduced to 0 Hit Points by means other than fire damage, disintegration, or its resurrection vulnerability, it returns to unlife at the start of its next turn. It has 100 Hit Points and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{倒地 Prone} in the space in which it was destroyed. The unrisen can't be returned by this ability again for 1 hour.

Agonized Howl.name: Agonized Howl
Agonized Howl.description: The unrisen howls in pain at its cursed existence. Creatures within a @Template[type:emanation|distance:30] take [[/r {9d8}[mental]]]{9d8 mental伤害} (@Check[type:will|dc:30|basic:true]). The unrisen can't use Agonized Howl again for [[/br 1d4 #Agonized Howl Recharge]]{1d4轮}.

Awful Approach.name: Awful Approach
Awful Approach.description: The unrisen reshapes its grotesque form to move swiftly. It Strides twice. Any living creature that can see the unrisen during this movement must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:28] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 2} on a critical failure). This is a mental and visual effect. The unrisen can't use Awful Approach again for [[/r 1d4 #Awful Approach Recharge]]{1d4轮}.

Death Grip.name: Death Grip
Death Grip.description:
需求 The unrisen has a living creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{擒抱 Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}

效果 The unrisen attempts to destroy its victim's life force to share the unrisen's fate. The creature must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:30] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 1}. While the curse lasts, the creature regains only half as many HP from positive healing effects; if it dies, any attempt to raise it from the dead causes it to return as an unrisen. The curse ends automatically if the creature's doomed value is reduced to 0.

Urveth.name: Urveth
Urveth.publicNotes:
An urveth is a massive, four-armed burrowing terror with a wormlike body and gaping maw that devours everything it can. Urveths burrow deep underground to hide from the sun, emerging under the cover of darkness to kill and consume.

Darvakkas, also called nightshades, are a ravenous evil made up of equal parts darkness and malice. Originally creatures of the Outer Planes who travel to the convergence of the Shadow Plane and the Negative Energy Plane—where the power of nothingness obliterates them—these undead abominations are the physical embodiment of entropy. They burn with an intense hatred for all life, working to bring a final, dark night to the Material Plane where nothing but ash and ice remain.

As creatures twisted by darkness and shadow, darvakkas have a great aversion to sunlight and all sources of positive energy. On the Material Plane, they spend the hours of daylight hidden below ground, amid ruins, or submerged deep in the ocean's darkest chasms beyond the reach of the sun's rays, emerging when darkness shelters them overhead.

Darvakkas have an aura of entropy that attracts undead thralls to serve as warriors and heralds. They rarely seek alliances with each other or other creatures, existing in solitude as the heads of individual armies of the dead.

Attack of Opportunity.name: 借机攻击 Attack of Opportunity
Attack of Opportunity.description:
Claw only. An urveth gains 3 extra reactions each round that they can use only to make Attacks of Opportunity.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.AttackOfOpportunity]

Entropy's Shadow.name: Entropy's Shadow
Entropy's Shadow.description:
@Template[type:emanation|distance:60]{60尺} @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{灵光}

Urveths leak entropy and corruption from their very being. A living creature entering or starting its turn in the aura takes [[/r {5d6}[negative]]]{5d6负能量伤害} with a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:38|basic:true]. If it fails, it's also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} for 1 minute and pulled 10 feet toward the urveth.

Sunlight Powerlessness.name: Sunlight Powerlessness
Sunlight Powerlessness.description: A urveth caught in sunlight is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{震慑 Stunned 2}和@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{笨拙 Clumsy 2}.

Frenzy.name: Frenzy
Frenzy.description: The urveth makes two claw Strikes and one stinger Strike in any order.

Swallow Whole.name: 活吞 Swallow Whole
Swallow Whole.description:
Huge, [[/r {2d10+5}[bludgeoning]]]{2d10+5 bludgeoning}, Rupture 35

A living creature that ends its turn swallowed whole by an urveth becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} or increases its drained condition by 1, and the urveth gains 10 temporary Hit Points. A creature whose drained condition increases to 5 in this way dies.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.SwallowWhole]

Urveth Venom.name: Urveth Venom
Urveth Venom.description:
豁免检定 @Check[type:fortitude|dc:37]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

阶段1 [[/r {3d6}[negative]+{2d6}[poison]]]{3d6 negative damage and 2d6 poison伤害} (1 round)

阶段2 [[/r {3d6}[negative]+{2d6}[poison]]]{3d6 negative damage and 2d6 poison伤害}，和@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} (1 round)

阶段3 [[/r {3d6}[negative]+{2d6}[poison]]]{3d6 negative damage and 2d6 poison伤害}，和@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 4} (1 round)

Vanyver.name: Vanyver
Vanyver.publicNotes:
Vanyvers are large, humanoid bats shaped from void and shadowstuff, their red eyes glowing like tiny stars in an otherwise lightless night. Though powerful, they're the least of the darvakkas, and the most likely to submit to a master, either another of their kind or a mortal with a reputation for being especially murderous and destructive. Vanyvers agree to follow their masters as a temporary means of maximizing the death and destruction they can enact but will quickly turn on any master they feel falters in this goal.

Darvakkas, also called nightshades, are a ravenous evil made up of equal parts darkness and malice. Originally creatures of the Outer Planes who travel to the convergence of the Shadow Plane and the Negative Energy Plane—where the power of nothingness obliterates them—these undead abominations are the physical embodiment of entropy. They burn with an intense hatred for all life, working to bring a final, dark night to the Material Plane where nothing but ash and ice remain.

As creatures twisted by darkness and shadow, darvakkas have a great aversion to sunlight and all sources of positive energy. On the Material Plane, they spend the hours of daylight hidden below ground, amid ruins, or submerged deep in the ocean's darkest chasms beyond the reach of the sun's rays, emerging when darkness shelters them overhead.

Darvakkas have an aura of entropy that attracts undead thralls to serve as warriors and heralds. They rarely seek alliances with each other or other creatures, existing in solitude as the heads of individual armies of the dead.

Catching Bite.name: Catching Bite
Catching Bite.description:
触发 A creature within reach of the vanyver's jaws makes a melee Strike against the vanyver with a weapon

效果 The vanyver chooses to be hit. If the attack would've missed, it hits. The vanyver catches the weapon in their jaws and uses Drain Magic on it without fulfilling Drain Magic's requirements.

Drain Magic.name: Drain Magic
Drain Magic.description:
需求 The vanyver's last action was a successful jaws Strike against a creature, object, or spell effect

效果 The vanyver casts an innate @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} on the same target; if the target was a creature, the vanyver can target a spell affecting the creature instead. If a spell effect or item is successfully counteracted, the vanyver gains temporary Hit Points equal to double the counteract level of the effect that was counteracted.

Entropy's Shadow.name: Entropy's Shadow
Entropy's Shadow.description:
@Template[type:emanation|distance:40]{40尺} @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{灵光}

Vanyvers leak entropy and corruption from their very being. A living creature entering or starting its turn in the aura takes [[/r {3d6}[negative]]]{3d6负能量伤害} with a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:30|basic:true]. If it fails, it's also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} for 1 minute and pulled 10 feet toward the vanyver.

Snatch.name: Snatch
Snatch.description: The vanyver can Fly at half Speed while they have a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{擒抱 Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} in either or both of their talons, carrying that creature along with them.

Sunlight Powerlessness.name: Sunlight Powerlessness
Sunlight Powerlessness.description: A vanyver caught in sunlight is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{震慑 Stunned 2}和@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{笨拙 Clumsy 2}.

Vetalarana Emergent.name: Vetalarana Emergent
Vetalarana Emergent.hp: mental rebirth, 快速愈合 10, 负能量治疗
Vetalarana Emergent.publicNotes:
Vetalarana vampires feed on the emotions, thoughts, and memories of others. Although they are capable of feeding on animals, beings of the planes, and other intelligent undead, only the thoughts of an intelligent, living humanoid bring a vetalarana any sense of satisfaction. Slender and pale, with sunken cheeks and exceptionally long nails, vetalaranas become flushed with color and life after feeding on particularly potent emotions and thoughts, enabling some to pass as living for a short time.

A vetalarana is created when a person with psychic or occult abilities dies in denial of their death, refusing to pass on to the afterlife but unable to retain their grip on life. As their spirit has no cause left undone nor debt to settle, these tenacious souls rise not as ghosts but as vetalaranas, a formidable and tenacious mind animating their own corpse in a mockery of life.

A vetalarana's predations inevitably turn their victims into living husks, incapable of thought and devoid of any spark of personality. These victims fall into a senseless stupor, comatose but still living, without identity or memories. If a vetalarana is killed, they can occupy one of these comatose husks, while more powerful vetalaranas can control them like living puppets.

When a vetalarana is destroyed, all of their comatose victims are immediately freed. Most often, these people regain consciousness as amnesiacs whose memories return over time—taking at least months but sometimes as long as decades. These returned memories are fragmented and often jumbled with the thoughts of others the vetalarana fed upon. If a victim served as a failed host or was frequently controlled while comatose, a sliver of the vetalarana's corrupted thoughts remain in the victim's mind. These tainted victims recover much faster than their fellows, regaining their memories in record time and transforming into a new vetalarana soon after.

A vetalarana emergent is inexperienced and ravenous, often caring more for the consumption of thoughts than the quality of the thoughts and memories consumed. These undead gluttons gorge themselves on memories, leaving a crowd of addled and terrified victims in their wake. Experienced emergents are cannier than their newly risen kin, stalking their chosen victims and being sure to abduct, kill, or render their victims comatose after draining their memories to ensure no witnesses remain to reveal the presence of a vetalarana.

Mental Rebirth.name: Mental Rebirth
Mental Rebirth.description:
Unlike most other undead, a vetalarana isn't destroyed when they reach 0 HP. Instead, their body is destroyed, crumbling to ash, and their mind is immediately transferred into a creature they rendered comatose through Drain Thoughts. This creature must be within 1 mile; if no such creature is in range, the vetalarana is destroyed. The creature becomes controlled by the vetalarana and loses the stupefied and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} conditions. If the creature controlled by a vetalarana in this way is killed, the vetalarana's mind transfers to another creature within 1 mile who they rendered comatose through Drain Thoughts.

After [[/r 1d6 #days]]{1d6 days} of being controlled, the controlled creature dies, and its body transforms into that of the vetalarana who rendered it comatose.

Vetalarana Vulnerabilities.name: Vetalarana Vulnerabilities
Vetalarana Vulnerabilities.description:
All vetalaranas possess the following weaknesses.

  • Barred Senses A vetalarana can't see or sense through force effects or cold iron, and their mind can't penetrate force effects or cold iron. Such barriers can prevent the transference of a vetalarana's mind through Mental Rebirth.
  • Revulsion A vetalarana delights in consuming memories and secrets, and is disgusted by those who share such sensitive tidbits openly. A vetalarana can't voluntarily come within 10 feet of a creature loudly voicing their intimate personal secrets or most cherished memories aloud. Speaking such information aloud with conviction is a single action that has the auditory, concentrate, and linguistic traits, and protects the creature until the start of its next turn. A vetalarana that involuntarily comes within 10 feet of a creature sharing such information gains the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.sDPxOjQ9kx2RZE8D]{Fleeing} condition until they're 10 feet or farther from the creature. After 1 round of being exposed to the secrets of a creature, a vetalarana can attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:25] save as a single action, which has the concentrate trait. On a success, they overcome their revulsions for [[/r 1d6 #rounds]]{1d6轮} (or 1 hour on a critical success).
  • Vulnerable to Brain Destruction A vetalarana whose brain has been destroyed, or is reduced to 0 HP while unable to take mental actions, can't use Mental Rebirth.

Anticipatory Attack.name: Anticipatory Attack
Anticipatory Attack.description: The vetalarana emergent uses consumed memories to anticipate their prey's movements. The vetalarana emergent's Strikes deal an additional [[/r {1d8}[precision]]]{1d8精准伤害} to creatures stupefied due to the vetalarana's Drain Thoughts.

Drain Thoughts.name: Drain Thoughts
Drain Thoughts.description:
需求 A @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{擒抱 Grabbed}，@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{麻痹 Paralyzed}，@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}，@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious}, or willing creature is within the vetalarana's reach

效果 The vetalarana seizes a creature and consumes its memories. This requires an Athletics check against the victim's Fortitude DC if the victim is grabbed and is automatic for any of the other conditions. The victim is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{呆滞 Stupefied 1}, and the vetalarana regains [[/r 10 #Hit Point]]{10 HP}, gaining any excess as temporary Hit Points. Draining Thoughts from a creature that is already stupefied doesn't restore any HP to the vetalarana but increases the victim's stupefied value by 1. Additionally, the vetalarana views one of the victim's memories.

A victim's stupefied condition value decreases by 1 every week.

A victim that becomes stupefied 5 in this way is rendered comatose, becoming permanently @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious}. As long as the vetalarana lives, a comatose victim can't regain consciousness, and its stupefied condition doesn't decrease.

Vetalarana Manipulator.name: Vetalarana Manipulator
Vetalarana Manipulator.hp: mental rebirth, 快速愈合 10, 负能量治疗
Vetalarana Manipulator.publicNotes:

A vetalarana manipulator is a gifted strategist, empowered by the memories, thoughts, and talents the manipulator has drained from countless victims and honed by centuries of survival. Certain of their own superiority, manipulators twist free-willed individuals for their own ends as easily as they control their comatose puppets.

LigXwWUfSvwcEKm4.name: 思维感知 (精确感官) 100 尺
LigXwWUfSvwcEKm4.description: The vetalarana senses all non-mindless creatures within 100 feet as a precise sense.

Mental Rebirth.name: Mental Rebirth
Mental Rebirth.description:
Unlike most other undead, a vetalarana isn't destroyed when they reach 0 HP. Psychic Superiority.name: Psychic Superiority
Psychic Superiority.description:
触发 A creature targets the vetalarana manipulator with a mental effect or spell

效果 The manipulator psychically lashes out at the triggering creature, dealing [[/r {3d8}[mental]]]{3d8 mental伤害} (@Check[type:will|dc:24|basic:true]).

Vetalarana Vulnerabilities.description:

  • Barred Senses A vetalarana can't see or sense through force effects or cold iron, and their mind can't penetrate force effects or cold iron. Such barriers can prevent the transference of a vetalarana's mind through Mental Rebirth.

  • Vulnerable to Brain Destruction A vetalarana whose brain has been destroyed, or is reduced to 0 HP while unable to take mental actions, can't use Mental Rebirth.

Control Comatose.name: Control Comatose
Control Comatose.description:
频率 每天一次

效果 The vetalarana manipulator spends 10 minutes to take psychic control of the creatures they've rendered comatose with Drain Thoughts. This has the effects of the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.wU6hNzK8Yfqdmc8m]{Possession} spell, but lasts for up to 6 hours, has a range of 1 mile, and the vetalarana can control a number of comatose victims at a time equal to half the vetalarana's level. A comatose victim can't resist this possession and automatically gets a critical failure on its saving throw against Control Comatose.

As long as a comatose victim is controlled by a vetalarana manipulator in this way, the victim's stupefied and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} conditions are temporarily suppressed.

Drain Thoughts.name: Drain Thoughts
Drain Thoughts.description:
需求 A @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{擒抱 Grabbed}，@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{麻痹 Paralyzed}，@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}，@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious}, or willing creature is within the vetalarana's reach
